text: Not impressed with this place! The service is great, but the food, No! Started with rissoto balls. They were way to mushy, had the brisket sandwich and fries. A complete joke. I have had better fries at McDonalds. Will not be back!

First time and probably the last time I've dined there.    VERY noisy,  slow service.   Food was okay though a bit salty.   Lots of menu items listed garlic.  One large roll to split between my wife and I.   It was very good but the second offered roll never came.
Abby is the best!!! She made suggestions on what to get and how they taste best and she was 1000% right!! Great friendly service. Ask for Abby if you go!!
Terrible. First time here too. Dry dry pancakes eggs were bland and sausage taste different than pork sausage. Won't be coming again
Excellent service and delicious Eggs Benedict. Enjoyable experience. The server was gracious and efficient.  The food was hot and tasty.
On two separate occasions the customer service was horrible. The second time I even had hair in my food.

Decent enough place, but nothing overly special. The restaurant itself is stylishly laid out and nicely decorated, but ultimately that's where the attraction ends. On the whole the food is pretty generic and a little overpriced for what you get- if you're looking for a true diner experience (particularly if you're set on a good breakfast), I much prefer the Park 51 Cafe a few miles away.  The only real plus I can give Big View is their dessert menu. It's a nice stop if you're out late with friends and get a hankering for a slice of pie.

Stopped here for breakfast this morning during the morning rush. 15 minute wait was not bad at all. We were seated in the bar area which was nice, ordered coffees and placed our order for breakfast. 40 minutes later we were still waiting for our breakfast. Once our scrambled eggs and eggs benedict arrived, the food was room temperature and blah with no flavor. Eggs benedict had firm centers, and was served with ONE of the smallest pieces of asparagus I've ever seen. We were not impressed.   It's too bad the service was slow and the food was really disappointing. It's hard to mess up breakfast, but they succeeded. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere and setting, but it's too bad it can't produce the service and food necessary for me to come back.

I have eaten here twice - dinner and breakfast. Both times the food exceeded the expectations I had based on past reviews.  The entree salad with quinoa was outstanding. The Farmer Tom veggie omelette was loaded with fresh veggie and made me feel less guilty about eating their outstanding grits.

Went there for the first time in a long time for dinner. Have gone a few times for breakfast. Our server was very attentive and prompt. Very interested in what we wanted, very personable, etc  We first ordered the calamari and then the fried risotto balls. Both were great. My son is a calamari freak, but these have chili line sauce and not his style. I ate the whole thing.   I had a big burger with immense onion rings. I couldn't finish it, but it was great. Wife had a salad with grilled chicken. Pretty plain, but she enjoyed it.   Decent local draft selection. NoDa, Triple C, Birdsong and OMB all on tap which is important to me.   Overall, a solid evening with the family.

Went on Friday night with my wife.  The wait was 20 min, or immediate if we sat at the counter, which is what we did.  My wife ordered the BLT, which was outstanding...it was a bit different than typical BLTs; it had cheddar cheese, three slices of bread, good tomatoes, good crisp bacon, and a little pesto.  This was served with home made vinegar chips (could barely taste the vinegar).  I had the Peppered Chopped Steak, which was outstanding.  Meat was tender and flavorful with peppers and onions, served with mashed potatoes and a side (i got green beans).  Food rated 5 out of 5 for what it was...good comfort food.  The only real negative was the service.  It was a bit slow and our server seemed a bit ditzy.  Also, there seemed to be a 4:1 ratio of managers to servers.  Lots of guys standing around in ties, when a couple of more servers would have been better for the dining experience.  Will definitely go back again.

The service is great, but the food is less than average.   Three out of four meals missed.    I had scrambled eggs, bacon, and toast:  scrambled eggs were almost completely white as if there was no yolk.  toast was black (can't believe they served it.) bacon was good.  Wife had: grilled chicken salad.  chicken was dried out, and drenched with dressing.  she could not eat it.  child had: spaghetti with butter.  for some reason the salt content was through the roof.  we are not that picky.  wife and i both tried it and it was as if someone dumped salt on it.  the server handled this well, apologized and was fast to fix it.  the 2nd attempt was good.  the first attempt was not even edible.  child had: chicken fingers/fries.  very good, however i will note this child ordered water for a drink, (no one else had water.)  after my kid complained about the water, my wife and I both tried it to see if this was a real complaint.  well, it was not drinkable.  it either had remnants of detergent in the glass, OR they need a new filter.  it tasted like the worst tap water I've ever had.  also, it's over-priced.  could have went to so many other places in the neighborhood.  the floor staff is outstanding though.  very well trained in that regard.  i do like this place because of the staff, hopefully they get their kitchen in order.

Shoddy, over compensating food. French onion soup? More like onions and bread with some actual soup. Would be way better if they simplified their food and condensed their menu.   Best part is the milkshakes and the service. Always nice, polite and smiling.  Don't come in if you're hot and just want a glass of water though. Everything is over-priced and the breakfast menu is the best one. Good for a family experience like brunch, not much else.

Tables were not clean. We were seated and not offered drinks for at least 10 minutes. We had only 2 interactions with our server. The first was when she took our order. The second was when she brought our bill. We were never offered refills nor asked if we needed anything.

Enjoyed this restaurant with family a couple weeks ago, and we all loved it and can't wait to go back! I ordered the braised beef brisket and it was the most tender piece of meat I have ever tasted. The only thing I found odd what that the servers were dressed very formally as was the atmosphere yet many of the patrons were very casual... not sure if the place tries to be upscale or not. Otherwise, the food is great!

I wanted to like the food at this diner but it was nothing special at all. Our server told us the chef could prepare fish and chips since it was not on the menu and two of us had a craving! Chips were nicely served, but ordinary. Fish? Cold and batter very disappointing. Ketchup and tarter sauce were served in tiny plastic cups and half filled at that.  Turkey club was piled high but just an average club sandwich.   I think we will pass on this diner the next time the 4 of us go out for lunch. Service and decor was ok. Prices for this kind of food a bit high.

Talk about a disappointment. We walk in and it looks busy. They tell us it's a 15 minute wait. No problem. So we look over the vast menu and marvel at how good the desserts look in the display up front. When they get around to seating us, they put us at a bar table that was open the whole time. They could have sat us right away!  So then we order. The waiter seemed overly nervous and we could barely even hear what he was saying. I ordered a sweet tea and it tasted like sugar water with a hint of gym sock. Uh oh. But we were hungry and still ordered. My girlfriend ordered the fish and chips while I got the classic diner cheeseburger.   The food was awful. The fries were not fresh. They had the consistancy of leather and probably had been sitting under a lamp for a while. This was on a Saturday night... no excuse for getting old food. The fish was garbage. It was lukewarm and soggy. Telltale signs of food that had been sitting out. The only thing that was any good was the burger... but it wasn't anything I couldn't have gotten at a Chili's or something.   At this point we decided we should probably pass on dessert. There was an entire plate of fish and chips with barely anything eaten and the waiter asked if we wanted a box. Yeah... maybe one to barf in. Hmm, maybe he should have thought to mention to a manager that it looks like one of the tables didn't like their food.   So if you like clueless service, old food and a generally sucky time, then take your ass to Big View pronto!

More like big waste of time. I would have liked to been able to write a review based on food quality, but we never got our food. Yep, you read that right ...never got our food. My boyfriend and I were looking for a new place and since we were in the area we decided to stop. It was your typical friday lunch scene, not overly crowded though. Sat down and ordered drinks and heard a welcome speech delivered from who I believed to be a manager about how "great" the upscale diner was.   Within minutes we ordered and now fast forward 30 minutes later, still no food. Manager and waitress practically run pass our table and avoid eye contact. This order was for a burger and a wrap, mind you. I know kitchens get busy and nothing is perfect but acknowledge us. Bring us bread or something . Nope. Instead we were told by the manger that" two twelve tops came in at the same time." Okay and that would be a huge problem if your place had seating for 50, but not for over 100. poor excuse, poor customer service. One star only because no stars won't register.

I've eaten here several times and am always impressed with the service and food. The menu has food for the hearty eaters as well as the dieters.  As a low-cal gal, I like the egg white burrito. It has veggies, fruit, and turkey sausage. Yum!
Great service and DELICIOUS food! Our server was fantastic. Greek salad was to die for. Highly recommend! Great service, great food and great atmosphere.

I've read the reviews and while most are very good, there are some that are just way out of line. We took the kids to try it out. Don't let the 3 stars fool you. This is a true blue diner.  Kids had the pancakes and bacon, and of course they weren't steered wrong. Accompanied with birthday cake milkshakes, how could you go wrong.  I had the the turkey club, which isn't on the menu. Tasted great, just what you wanted the day before Christmas.  Again don't let the nay Sayers push you away. We really enjoyed the place and will be back soon.
Good food, friendly waitstaff. Solid diner in my opinion. I got the mushroom omelette, and it was done just right. Try it out!

For starters, the food is always really good.  The service.....drives me nuts and makes me not go there as often.I truly appreciate fast service, but consistently being asked if I want to order dessert while I'm only 1/2 way through dinner makes me feel incredibly rushed. Not to mention when they clear my plate while my wife is still eating dinner makes her feel rushed. Now, if we go there at all, all we think about is whether the waitress is going to rush us out of there.  I understand its a business, but this is not good service, faster is not always better.  I'm from NY and we like things fast, except when we are trying to enjoy a nice meal.  Solutions??

Great food and service! Went with traditional Greek salad (all tomatoes cucumbers) no lettuce and topped with broiled salmon - really good and healthy so ended with the Camilo cream cake ( a big slice ) of chocolate cake layered with mars alone and whipped cream  Lots to choose from in the "diner" meat and potato categories too

The food is amazing.  I went for my lunch break one afternoon and the service was quick and pleasant.  The hostesses were very friendly and wait staff knew their stuff.  I ended up ordering the calamari as an appetizer and the taste was like no other.  What a different idea they had with that besides your typical fried calamari with marinara sauce.  My main meal was the Spaghetti and meatballs.  The sauce was so delicious.  They were not missing a thing.  The meatballs were tender.  I would recommend the Big View Diner to anyone!  You will not be disappointed.  The place on the inside is just beautiful!

We sat at the tall counter near the kitchen and we were able to get a behind the scenes look at what's going on in the facility. Good waitstaff. Cooks working nonstop. Girl working the bakery dept = bad attitude, picking up food with bare hand after handling money, put on glove then picked up dirty cleaning cloth and wiped down counters and picked up food after with the same glove on. Employees picking ice cubes up off the dirty counter and putting them back into the pile to be distributed into glasses. Inside of glasses being wiped with dirty towels then filled with drinks. Decent food, but not sanitary. Would not recommend a piece of cake, milkshake or anything else from the bakery.
Big view is a good place for family or friends.  The menu is huge!  Get about anything you want anytime!  Enjoy!

Terrible experience. They didn't have our reservation in the computer, but there were plenty of tables available so no big deal. Then It took our server 15 minutes to even show her face at our table and there was no smile in sight. When we finally got our food, my daughter asked for a plate for her shrimp tails and it took forever to get one. When we ordered dessert it took over 10 minutes to get it. The topper was when we gave an Amex gift card for payment and the server came back to say she was sorry but their system didn't recognize them. When we refused to pay any other way she had a manager come over to repeat what she said. Our daughter had to explain to them how to run it and state that she works at a restaurant so she knows what she's talking about. Another 10 minutes goes by and guess what?  They figured out how to run it. In all, it took 2 hours to eat here. It was really hard to leave a tip with this terrible service but we did.

St. Louis burger was very good. Nice clean decor .. However... They were advertising a special on each table... "August 24 -National Peach Pie Day- Individual Housemade Peach Pies with Vanilla Ice Cream-$7" when asking about the special.. Waitress said that they forgot to make the pies today... (When she asked the manager we observed he pounded his fist on the counter and went straight to the bakery) Really? Terrible management...wow..

Beyond horrible service. We have tried this place 3 times now but this past visit was our last. This is NOT a diner similar to NY/NJ style. It's slow slow slow. We get there and was told there would be a 20-30 minute wait or we can go to the bar. So we decided to go to the bar since we didn't want to wait 20 minutes. we sit down and notice a good 5-7 empty tables around us that could have been cleaned off for those waiting to sit. We ask the hostess if we can sit at one the the tables and she looks at me like I'm insane and points to the crowd of people waiting and said (with an attitude) "all these people are waiting for tables. You can sit at the bar or put your name on the list and wait for a table." We decided to stay at the bar. We order our food and another 2 couples sit at the bar with us. After about 20 minutes later they get their food and we are still waiting for ours. I ask the server if our food is coming out shortly and she yells back "we're just busy, baby" with an attitude. Didn't bother to check on it or anything just yells it back to us.   We are sitting at this bar without food now for well over 45 minutes and half cups of cold coffee. We ask the server to check on our food. She looks at the computer and says we are one table away from getting our food so we stay... another 10 minutes go by and nothing. We ask again for our food so she goes to the kitchen and looks. My husband has the completely WRONG order. Missing eggs and bacon. I ordered over easy eggs and these were fully cooked eggs completely dried out and cold. Both meals were complete cold. Like inedible cold. Pancake was a puck and sausage was still ice cold in the middle but we tried to make the most of it and just eat so we can leave. I took a bite of my husbands pancakes and realized it was completely dried out. So I ask the hostess to send over a manager and she gives me an attitude. A manager came out asking what the problem was. Literally asked what OUR problem was. I explained the situation and he looked like he could care less. He offered us a gift card. I explained again how our meal was inedible and we will not be paying for this meal. As we were waiting for him to credit our meal, another gentleman comes up to the manager saying they have been sitting without menus or drinks for well over 15 minutes and said they will walk out if they don't served soon. What is going on there??? There was a ton of employees just standing around so definitely not short staffed. It is poorly managed!!! Totally inexcusable. The place was far from busy!!! As we left there was a crowd of people in the front waiting for seats while a ton of tables were dirty as employees just gathered around or walked past.   I can't believe this place even has 3 stars. Food is horrible and service would have been comical if we weren't so hungry. We left and went home to make breakfast. What was suppose to be a nice breakfast out to celebrate a life event turned into over an hour ordeal without even eating. I looked at my Fitbit, we were sitting for a total of 75 minutes.... 75 minutes to get breakfast that was cold.
It was crowded, on about a 20min wait. Sat in the bar area, got great service and a fantastic burger!

THIS RESTAURANT SUCKS!!! We went here and were waiting for 2 hours!!!! They sat multiple people in front of us. This is RIDICULOUS!!! Then when we FINALLY got seated. We ordered and waited ANOTHER HOUR!!!! The food wasn't good either. It wasn't as bad as the service (which isn't saying much) but it's below average. PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE!!!!

LOVE the Big View Diner. Have visited for both breakfast and lunch. Although this place can get quite full during peak hours, we have never had an unreasonable wait (10 minutes max). The food is delicious and the servers are all very friendly and attentive. Desserts are amazing (though HUGE - would recommend sharing).

Update: Too much of a good thing is a bad thing. The service and food seemed to trail off during the holidays, and just after Christmas we were sold extremely stale and old cookies from their bakery. Because of this we will take our time before trying them out again.  Previous Review: The hubby and I eat here about once a week. Have had a ton of things on the menu and everything has always tasted great. Breakfast plates, french toast, pancakes. Shrimp & grits, chicken souvlaki, spinach pastry, greek salad, crab cake. All tasty! And we love their bakery. The service is generally very friendly and on point. Don't recommend eating at the bar in view of the kitchen because it gets chaotic, but otherwise enjoy dining here. Definitely recommend.

Yuck. So disappointed. I love Ilios Noches and Nolen's Kitchen (same owners). I've tried this place twice and both times it was crawling with noisy children, the staff seemed stressed and unfriendly, and the food very average. It has an IHOP feel about it. Not going back.

Great place to take kids. My son got both the spaghetti and the pancakes with eggs and bacon for dinner (post football practice) and I got a delicious goat cheese turkey burger lettuce wrap with basil veggies. Abby was our waitress and she was very helpful! We will def be back!
Good family-friendly restaurant. Expected a diner, but it looks like Cheesecake Factory on the inside. Service was a bit slow on a Friday night, but it was busy.

What a huge dissapointment.  The service was slow, the food was bad, and the cost was high.  We were seated pretty quickly, especially for noon on a Saturday.  Then we waited 15 minutes for the waitress to take our order.  Then we waited another 30 minutes for the food.  When the food finally arrived it was greasy, salty, and poorly cooked.  My daughter's grilled cheese wasn't even cooked long enough to melt the cheese and it was salty (how is a grilled cheese salty?).  The fries were stale, like they were fried 20 minutes ago and baking under a heat lamp until they got to my table.  I was really looking forward to finding a good diner in South Charlotte, this was not it.

This place is just ok for me.  Sort of a hit and miss kind of a place.  They have a large menu with lots of selection.  The kids menu is decent and my boys enjoy the food.  Kids do get a free cookie at the end of the meal, which is always a hit.  For some reason it's always cold in this place too.  I know that may sound odd, but my wife actually plans ahead and brings a "light jacket" when we eat here.  It's always chilly.

The food IS really good esp the desserts! The service is good and the establishment is nice. Its a tad pricey, but you do get decent portions on MOST dishes. Not the fish tacos...that portion is too small.

We come here all the time. We decided to try breakfast this am and we had the worst server ever. She could not be bothered with us. The service was horrible, she had an attitude as well. Might have been nice if she checked on us. I guess they have the "B" team on in the morning because this was not the same service we get at night. The best was I thought I was in a restaurant but when she told me I could take my check up to the front to pay was the kicker!!!!
Like this place very much. Will come back often! Recommend the breakfast pastry basket if u wanna sample different pastries.

I LOVE BIG VIEW! They have a fantastic breakfast/brunch menu, as well as an extensive lunch/dinner menu. The menu is always changing so there is always something new to try. The staff is very knowledgable about the dishes they serve. They have a bakery as well so there are cases full of treats that are delicious. There's really nothing bad at Big View - the people, the food, and the Bloody Mary's are all fantastic!  update: the best part of Big View is that they really pay attention to the customer - the changing menu is dictated by what patrons ask for and what they're no longer ordering. However, even when favorite dishes fall off the menu, they'll make them for you if you want them!

Service is pretty good, although I had to keep asking for things like cream and silverware, etc. The ladies restroom is mostly clean but unkept with paper and waste strewn about. While I was in there another lady got locked in the handicap stall and I literally had to kick the door in to let her out. I went to tell the manager about the problem with the lock and found him standing in front of the food service line, eating food and took plated food to another customers table still chewing whatever was in his mouth. I believe they did address the bathroom stall. Food is ok but I think a little pricey for its value and it took forever to come out of the kitchen. They also served burnt French toast that needed to be sent back and my son said the chicken Apple sausage was inedible and switched to bacon with the next plate - this plate was much better but he had to get it boxed since the rest of us had already finished our meals.
This place does have a lot of options just like a diner should but every option here is expensive. The parking here is okay the food is average at best.

Decided to eat dinner at Big View tonight. Big mistake! Arrived around 7:15pm and seated right away. It was a moderate crowd. After being seated at our table, we waited at least ten minutes waiting for someone to take our order. Just as i was getting up to find a manager, our server showed up. By now it was 7:30pm. We ordered two sodas and calamari appetizer. She (our server) brought us our drinks and took our dinner order, chicken souvlaki and chicken parmesan. After about twenty minutes, our appetizer had not arrived. My wife was starting to get irritated thinking we would get our appetizer with the entree. Finally the appetizer came. The calamari was lukewarm and chewy. However, the sauce was delicious and why I am giving one star on this review. My wife's salad arrived soon after and brought to us by a manager. We forgot to ask for refills and instead waited on server to come back. Another mistake. We could see her chatting behind the bar with same manager (red shirt). She was making gestures like she was choking him and he did the same back. Having a big time. Meanwhile we are watching many tables finish meals, pay their bills and leave. My wife was beside herself. Our drinks had not been refilled once nor had she come around to check on us. At 8:15 our entrees arrived and was brought to us by the manager not the server. My wife complained about the lack of attention and time it took. The manager was obviously patronizing to my wife with a total lack of empathy. She let him no that as well. He just walked away. The server came over with menus apologizing and offering free dessert. However, we were disgusted at this point and declined. We paid for our meal and left. Food ok but horrible service. We won't be back.

I'm not one to post negative reviews but after our third poor experience I don't feel I have much choice. We love Big View Diner, eat there quite regularly and have never had a bad meal - the food is always delicious - however the service is quite bad. Disappointingly so. The managers are wonderful and do their best to be accommodating but thirty minute ticket times (on more than one occasion), wrong orders, empty beverage glasses and missing checks kind of takes away from the experience.
We love this place! Food was great and our server Abby was so upbeat, funny, and helpful! Thanks for making my bday dinner a great night with more laughter!

This should be called Big Pew, they have no view poor service. They have a poor attitude . The food tasted like they emptied a container of salt into it. I had the roast turkey the white meat was pink? When I asked the waitress about it she didn't care at all.

Poor service right from the start we waited 45 mins for table when they told us 15 mins max, we were there for breakfast at 9:30am when we left it was time for lunch. I give it another year and they will be out of business you have to turn over tables quicker then every 2 hours. Food is fair to poor. S U C K SUCK SUCK SUCK!!!
This is a very high class diner. I had the Antipasti salad. Wow was that fantastic. The decor was elegant too.

I can't tell you to try this or that because every time I trynsomething new and I loved every meal. But I do suggest you try their strawberry cheesecake . And the service (dinning in or takinngnout)  is a 10/10. Thank you TEAM BIG VIEW!

Great food and great menu! I come here for personal and business reasons and the food itself is fantastic.   Service is sub-par, at best. My last visit was very irritating, you be the judge.  I placed a carry out order and they forgot to put my dessert in the bag. I called them when I arrived home and they said they would give me an extra one for the inconvenience. When I got there, they only have me one. I didn't bother asking for a free one. Shouldn't the manager go "above and beyond" and at the very least insist on something free for the inconvenience?  I'm not looking for a free handout, I'll certainly return since I love their food. But, the restaurant industry is so competitive and I know other places would feel as if they should've done something for the customers inconvenience. That's my two cents!

First time in the Charlotte area... staying nearby and my husband and I stopped in. Was looking for a little something to hold us over for dinner and the Food was really good.  May not even eat later... lol Sat at the bar and service was good as well. Will definitely visit again when in the area!

I've been to the Big View Diner often enough because it's close to home and what restaurant doesn't want a regular (uh... not Big View)!  I would now go somewhere else because of the  inconsistency in the final meal coming to the table...  my family has experienced dining in/out and meals have been good to bland because the cook left out an ingredient. You can tell the server about a bland dish but they don't know what to do about it.... they stick you with a meal without flavor ultimately. So, if you ask for the manager (because you must).... The on sight the manager never comes back to the table after talking to the cook and when you call in about missing ingredients you get the brush off.  Why have a manager???  I did like Big View Diner when it was good... but, I don't like the brush off I got when something that was bland!  Sorry Big View Diner you are no longer on my list of good places to go eat!!!
Love this place!  Awesome food, lots of options and good prices!  Service was also amazing.  Bakery is delicious!

I visited big view diner the night of march 10th I ordered jambalaya with a ceaser salad with whatever dressing came with it, and a garden salad with blue cheese dressing. Along with a cup of ice cream water and a lemonade I was told my order would be ready in 20 however I came in 35 to 40 min  and when I got there my order was never made . I understand mistakes are made and sometimes order tickets don't get turned in but the lady was acting as if it was everyone else fault but hers. 10 min later we finally got our food, we were expecting maybe a certain percentage off our meal for compensation of our food not being ready when we got there.  And the lady offered "an extra scoop of ice cream will that make you happy?" "And I gave u your drinks for free " oh really a water and lemonade ? I wasn't aware water cost nowadays. We just went back to our place for the night ready to sit down and eat and my food was placed in the box so messy that the juices basically all the flavor from my meal was spilled and gathered at the bottom of the bag,  I ate it anyway didn't taste too good but it was food. I decided I would talk to the manager first thing the next day and that's what I did. I called he was nice and cooperative and offered me a free appetizer and dessert my next visit  which I was thrilled about so I finally came in for my free starter and dessert tonight march 20th. I got strawberry cheesecake and disco Fries we got home the cheesecake was good my mother ate the disco fries and received a crunchy surprise a crouton in the disco fries! She said the fries tasted and looked old like they took left overs from someone's plate in the first place but she decided to give it a try anyway and that's what she was greeted with we will never be visiting big view diner again.

I love this place! Perhaps because it's super close to where I live, but let's be honest, it has a very warm feel to it and the people there are very helpful and pleasant to be around. I love that they serve breakfast 24/7 (not gonna lie, I've been there at 9pm and ordered the pancakes because they're to DIE for) and they have a huge variety on their menu. Their milkshakes are delicious and their bakery is adorable with tons to choose from. They give large portions and it's relatively cheap! Not to mention I can't take my eyes off of the light fixtures every time I'm in there. Big View Diner is up there on my list!

This is a regular restaurant we go to all the time.  They are usually very busy (that's a good sign) so we call ahead.  We enjoy eating on the outside patio.  Have never had a bad meal here.  As a side dish, the onion rings and the hush puppies are really good.

We have been eating breakfast every Saturday at the Big View. Imagine our surprise to find out all the prices have gone up by at least $1. That's right even a short stack of pancakes up $1. Now I had no idea the cost of pancake batter was so pricey. The coffee is so strong you can walk on water after one cup. Big View has lost 2 customers and my friends who dine there are going elsewhere also. We can go a few miles down the road to Park Place and get full breakfast for $4.45 plus a great cup of coffee. You should check it out, we have been very pleased.

Truly, truly a disappointment. I looked forward to Big View's opening, as I live very close to it. Hearing all the bad reviews, I figured I would order carryout one night. The way I looked at it, I couldn't get bad service if I didn't have to deal with a waiter.  Surprise - they managed to royally screw that up too! In fact, Big View Diner screwed up every single step of the way.  When I called, I asked for a menu item I found online, only to be told they didn't have that anymore. So I ordered something else.  I showed up and informed the hostess I was there for carryout. She told me nothing was ready and asked me to linger by the sweets display. I loitered in the area, making eye contact with staff who immediately looked down and went on their way for 15 minutes, watching the register area like a hawk to see if they were preparing anything for carryout.   FINALLY I went up to ask about my order. It had slipped my notice that my order was hidden to the side of the cash register, and had been sitting there for as long as I had been there! The cashier didn't even say anything about the fact I had stared at her for 15 minutes expectantly.  The food was cold by the time I got it home, 5 minutes later. And it was awful. I ordered the "hush puppies" which the menu said came with some kind of butter, but instead I got this thick, cheese sauce. For hush puppies??  I like Nolen Kitchen and Ilios Noche. I am baffled that this disaster of a restaurant is owned by the same folks. If I were Stratos, I would be humiliated to have my name and reputation attached to this "diner" with its horrible service, misrepresented food items, and sub-par food quality. In fact, my experience at Big View diner makes me wonder if I should bother going to ANY Stratos Restaurant Group establishment again. Were the others just flukes? Because it takes EFFORT to be as terrible as Big View Diner was in my first (and LAST) experience.

Honestly, I'd prefer to give Big View 3 1/2 stars, because neither 3 nor 4 stars are accurate ratings.  We started coming here when it first opened, and were immediately impressed...then the service and food suddenly went down the toilet. I chalked up the bad juju to a case of too much, too soon; eventually, once the appeal wears off, a restaurant's true colors will be revealed.   However, there have been some positive changes made to the menu. The menu is smaller now, and, most positive of all, there's a wide variety of healthier options now available. I enjoy their salads, actually; the Waldorf Apple salad is a tasty and eclectic mix of spinach, lightly grilled chicken, pine nuts, apples and a light vinagrette that will leave you stuffed.   The jury for me is still out on some of their dinner plates; the lemon chicken and their pan-seared fish seems a bit dry for my palate.  If you're bringing the little ones, Big View's management has also improved on their Kids' Menu; the sloppy spaghetti and cheese-soaked Mac n' Cheese has now been replaced with gluten-free hot dogs served on whole grain wheat buns, and whole wheat penne with mixed veggies. Who says kids can't enjoy a healthy meal out? Nice touch from BVD's management...well done!  And there there's the fabulous homemade desserts, of which the strawberry cheesecake is simply divine. You'll be hard-pressed to not savor any of their fantastic desserts...even if I've had to force myself to do so, because I'm watching my girlish figure...  Atmospherically, it's first-rate, giving off the feel of a retro diner, complete with plush leather benches and some fine pop-art touches. There's also a spacious cocktail bar, stocked with high-quality liquors, and their beer selection is quite impressive - lots of local craft beers and imports.  Overall, it's a satisfying experience. I'm glad Big View has improved.
Menu has some strange meals, got chicken parmesan and it was very dry. Been there twice over the last few years but I think I'll wait even longer before I go back IF I go back.

Service was not rude, but slow and unattentive. When asked what teas were available, answer was: "sweet and unsweet". The waitress has to be hunted down for coffee refills and any other requests. Food is a hit or miss depending on the items chosen. The greek omelet was good, but the farmer tom (veggie) was completely tasteless and the only thing i could taste in the breakfast potatoes was black pepper.

I have lived around the corner from here for far too long and it was finally time to check this place out.  Truthfully the lackluster reviews kept me away.  I went after church with a friend and my daughter. We were promptly seated, the waitress was very kind and professional and even helped me narrow down my burger selection.  I think at any diner the first place to start is with a burger and for me that's how I decide if I'll return.  I ordered the Texas Grande (angus steak and smoked bacon stuffed with pulled bbq brisket, cheddar, crispy jalapenos) with a side of fries. My daughter ordered the buffalo wings and the Caesar salad. I absolutely, positively loved, loved, loved my burger and fries.  No complaints, it was delicious and my food coma began before I even got up to leave.  I don't know if I will be brave enough to try anything else since I know this tastes so yummy. But for the good of yelp, I shall try. I tried one of my daughters wing and they were tasty. Not amazing but definitely up to par and worth ordering again.  She said her salad was good but some of the pieces were too big and chunky but nothing a knife and fork couldn't take care of.  The menu here is extensive and since my first experience here was a good one, I'll certainly go back and try other menu options but it's also cool that you can hit up their amazing bakery and just take some donuts, cakes, treats home with you to enjoy.  I can understand now how the reviews are all over the place because one, taste is subjective and two, with such a big menu I gather it's impossible to do all things well.  I believe the owners are Greek and I may try some of the Greek items to see how well they do them.  As of this review, I recommend you give this place a try, everyone in your party is bound to find something they like.  That is all!

Big View Diner is perfect if you are a buffalo looking for a nice salt lick. The chef was very heavy handed with the seasoning, almost to the point where the food was inedible. The diner was very pricy and did not deliver when it came to the "local yumminess" that diners often offer. Though the cake was divine, we will not be returning.

We went here the other night for dinner.  The diner's theme is cute - it reminds me of all the Long Island Diners I grew up going to.  The menu isn't as big as the LI Diners I'm used to, but those can be intimidating anyway.    Our appetizer was these pretzel bites and it was pretty random.  It came with 6 pretzel pieces and two sauces to dip them in.  I wasn't in love with this course.  I got the Spanikopta (Spinach Pie) and it was perfect!  My food was better than everyone else's though - I ordered well :)   Someone ordered the cheesecake for dessert and I tasted it.  It tasted way too lemony to me.  Overall, I'm not sure if I would return.

Visting my family for Thanksgiving. I was the only one who wanted turkey so I picked up a take out dinner.  It was great, good portion, food was good quality and tasted delicious.  The vegetables were yummy and a good variety. Only negative was the stuffing was soggy instead of moist and fluffy, this may have happened bc the gravy got mixed in.  I would suggest requesting the gravy in a separate container. The chocolate chip cookies were so delicious as well as the cherry pie. I will be back to visit for breakfast.  I am surprised at the other reviews for this place and other local restaurants.  I lived in Charlotte before moving to CA and have been to many of the local restaurants. Maybe its just me but Charlotte folk seem to be very critical of their local eateries. I am referring to a review left a few days ago about the condition of the restaurant.  There is a huge sign when you walk in stating that they are refurbishing the tables, booths, etc. As for the review about the under cooked omelet,  if you weren't happy you should have requested a new omelet and potatoes.  I would love to have these restaurants close to my home with fresh local produce.  Please try to support your local restaurants and give your feedback to the restaurant so they can work to improve what you dislike. At the end of the day they are here to serve you and make sure you are happy ;)
Went there for breakfast.  Half of the home fried were not cooked and the sausage would have been better suited to resole shoes, tough and dried out.  Service was also nothing to write home about.

I really like this place, nice and cozy. I went on the weekend of mother's day and everyone seemed to enjoy their food. I had the crab cake on the bun it was good but the sauce that comes with it was not tasty. The barbecue chicken wings were very good as well. The desert we had was the strawberry shortcake and it was OK.   Overall I want to go back to try out the rest of their menu.

This was my 3rd visit to BVD since it opened. The first 2 times we were there I was unimpressed with the food, but my family wanted to try it again, so we went this Sunday for brunch. The "all day breakfast" menu was all we were allowed to have since the regular breakfast menu ends at 11am. While disappointed, we understood. We were seated in the bar area after a brief wait and initially, service was good but went downhill fast. Our server was also bartending, so wearing 2 hats began to affect our service, we ordered my daughter's milkshake 3x. I give our server 5 stars though, he had a great attitude and was very nice, apologizing for our wait. The pimento stuffed jalapenos are HUGE!, but lacking in taste in a big way, no kick and the pimento cheese was runny and bland. The corned beef hash left my NJ, diner loving fiance unimpressed, as did my own greek omelet that was overcooked. The home fries really aren't "fries" but smushed greasy potatoes. Neither of us ate ours. On a brighter note, my teenage daughter liked her sliders and fries. We waited a long time between apps and our main dishes as well. I hate to give poor reviews, especially to Xenia, as we are big Ilios Noche fans, but after a third unimpressive experience at Big View, we won't be back.

Watched 5-6 tables of recent arrivals be served outside because that is where they chose to sit and wait to be called.  Seating and serving new arrivals without offering those tables to the crowd of people waiting inside is baffling.  We left after waiting over an hour and will not be returning.

A fresh take on Comfort food. I normally don't  love restaurants with expansive menus because I don't feel a restaurant with  a big menu can focus on everything to make everything good. This place is the exception. One of the first places we found when we moved to Charlotte something for every one can be found her. From Brisket and Black Bean Burgers to Salads and Pasta dishes this place has it. They have great specials and everything tastes fresh I don't know how they do it. They also have a wonderful bakery and make their own ice cream. You can even get Thanksgiving dinner in July.
The food is consistently mediocre. Not worth the price.  We will not be going back.

Had breakfast here this morning. Arrived at 9:30, party of 2, was seated in 10 minutes. Service was fast and friendly; I had coffee within 2 minutes of being seated. The Greek Omelette was great; loaded with ingredients. My dad had the pancakes with strawberries and whipped cream and they were AWESOME. Took a bit longer than it should have to get the check, but overall, it was great. I'll definitely be back.

Service is very poor. After waiting more than 30 minutes and party after party being seated we finally ask if we are coming up. They confirm we are, but 5 minutes later they admit they missed us. No apology, nothing. Never been impressed with the place. Don't go there.

A major disappointment, overall.  I'm from the north, and we love diners, so I was excited.  Unfortunately, I was sorely disappointed.   The first 2 times I went there, I had appetizers because I wasn't very hungry.  They were both pretty bad.  Still, when invited to join some friends for lunch, I accepted, hoping that maybe I'd find something yummy if I order an actual meal.  Again, I was disappointed.  I ordered a chicken gyro.  The chicken was tasteless (except for being overly salty) and very tough.  It was an extremely small portion too.  I'm glad it came with fries, although they were cold and very greasy, even for fries.  We were a party of 9, and no one liked their food at all, except for a 14-year-old, who ordered the chicken parmesean.  Even she admitted she's had better.  One guy at the table ordered a burger, and asked me to try it because he couldn't believe how awful it was.  I must admit, it was without a doubt the absolute worst burger I've ever had, hands down.  The meat was extremely hard and dry.  It was really inedible.  He was hungry, so he ate about 1/2 of it and left the rest.  Also, for a diner, it's pretty expensive.  I think the place is very attractive and comfortable, strictly from the standpoint of aesthetics.  Unfortunately, I'd rather have great food in a 'hole-in-the-wall' type of diner.  I don't go to a diner for the ambience.  I go for good, old-fashioned diner food.  It is not hard to make good food diner style.  I really hope they can step up in the future.  Maybe their breakfast food is good.  The only way I'd try them again is if I'm in the mood for breakfast.  I'm always looking for a good place for a lazy Saturday morning breakfast.

Had brunch.  It's ok.  A little upscale from Denny's.  price was ok but was expecting more.  Had the western omelette, thought the ham, onions, peppers should have been cooked more before being added to the eggs.
The food is super inconsistent. Sometimes is pretty good and sometimes it's terrible. The chicken noodle soup and chicken fingers are big the best items on the menu.

... I had previously stated, in an earlier review, that on my first visit, with others, which was on Dec 16, 2017.  We waited while everyone else and some, were seated before us, 35-49 minutes later, when we were told we'd have only a 10 minute wait.  We were then seated in a dark corner, where we had to use our flashlights just to see our menus.  Then we felt rushed by the waitress, who later brought our entrees.  After eating, leaving and attempting to do do additional Christmas shopping ALL 3 of use were forced to find the nearest restroom. This happened throughout the ENTIRE evening into the morning for all of us. Not much Christmas shopping was done. Now tell me that, that was just a coincidence?!!!  We took dog bags home and are deciding whether we should get the contents examined.  SMH!   ---------------------------------------------  Since this review was previously posted.  The owner and I have communicated.  I have since visited the establishment 2 additional times with friends and family.  Both myself, and the visitors I had invited agreed, the ambience, and the service was impeccable!  The food was also delicious, but the desserts where even better!  I would definitely recommend a visit to those of you who have not done so already.
Great variety!  Something for everyone.  My family has gone several times.  Many tempting desserts to choose from!

I really had high hopes for Big View Diner.  I have gone regularly to their Ilios Noche Restaurant and never had a bad meal there.   I have not found a good diner in Charlotte, and looked forward to eating there.  I went with a friend in June 2009.  Both of us were extremely disappointed with the food.  I ordered the chicken parmesan over pasta.  The pasta was cold, the chicken was tough and the sauce was runny and completely tasteless.   Even the bread was disappointing.  My friend ordered the meatloaf with mashed potatoes.  My friend also thought the meatloaf was tasteless and awful.  How could a diner get meatloaf wrong??  I was going to order the meatloaf too, but wanted to get to different things to be able to try.  The food was so bad, I decided not to return.

We have been here twice. It's a nice diner on the fancy side, definitively a step up or three from an IHOP or a Denny's.  The menu was large had something for everyone in the family.  If you are Gluten Free they have many options available which we found to be a pleasant surprise. On both occasions we found the staff to be pleasant and the food to be good.

We ran into the Big View for some drinks and milkshakes for the kids. We had some time before a movie and the restaurant was packed. With that being said the staff was wonderful, helpful and very friendly. Abby did a great job of taking care of us and if you ever want to get a great milkshake you should swing by. They will take great care if you, the manager was wonderful as well. Thanks for the great service.

Locally owned family restaurant in the Ballantyne neighborhood. A very diverse menu and upscale diner, these are prevalent in New Jersey and Charlotte is fortunate to have Big View. The desert selection was comprable to a bakery shop menu, fresh and large portions for a reasonable price. We love supporting restaurants like this and will definitely return.

Waited 45 minutes for our food. Had noticed waitstaff chatting it up with customers at other tables. Had to flag down waitress for everything. When food came, the waitress that brought it barely spoke. I ordered broiled seafood platter. It came swimming in grease. I ordered mushrooms instead of rice. They brought rice. Spinach was a grease bomb, too. Restaurant was not that busy.  Lousy, lousy experience all the way around.

We originally went just to use a gift card.  I was very impressed with the service, our server Cary was very engaging, and efficient.  The whole atmosphere was intriguing, as we got closer to 7 pm the Diner began filling up. The food was great. The variety was my favorite, with prices staring from $8, and healthy options like my Black Bean, and Quinoa Burger that even won over my carnivorous sister.  The complimentary bread was a highlight at our table.   I am definitely looking forward to going back.

I ate here last night for my first time, it was a wonderful experience! The service was great, everyone was so nice and friendly. The restaurant was clean and decorated nicely for Christmas. The manager was on the floor which means a lot for me to see him helping out his team. I'm sorry I didn't get his name but super cool gentleman! The food was ready in good time, it was delicious. They have a nice menu, it was hard to make a decision. I will definitely be going back and will bring family from out of town here as well. Not a negative thing to say, great restaurant!

I was shocked that there are so many poor reviews for the Big View. I like the variety on the menu and it is a kid friendly establishment without feeling like you are in the midst of a playground. The desserts always look delicious and it smell wonderful the minute you walk through the doors. The servers are very friendly and the service has always been great.

The food was good. Really big portions. The tables and chairs in the bar area leave a little to be desired, but no big deal. Milkshake was good. It was the blonde bartender I had issues with. She had the worst attitude I've ever seen. She cared more about the tables she thought would tip more than me. When I asked to sit at a booth that looked a little more comfortable, she made a face and told me she thought it had reservations. I'm not sure it did, but it sure didn't seem like it when it was sat. Then at one point she ditched my table and a completely new server took over. (She was great.) I don't think I'll be back because of the treatment I received, which is a shame because i think I would've liked it if I received better service. That young lady needs more training or a non customer facing job.

This was not a great place for lunch. I went with my mother in law who is gluten free and the options were not great. Also we had to sit outside because the inside smelled like dirty socks. Hopefully that was a random occurrence but I will not be returning to find out. Food was sub par.

I've been hearing about Big View Diner for some time but its kind of off the beaten path for me so I hadn't had the chance to try it until recently.  I have to say, I wasn't that impressed.  It seems like this place can't make up its mind.  Am I a diner?  Am I a bakery?  Am I a bar?  Who knows?    My dining companion and I tried it out on Labor Day.  Because of the holiday, they were offering brunch in addition to the regular menu.  Yay!  I am a big brunch fan!  There's a good mixture of breakfast and alcohol...what's not to like, right?  I ordered a mimosa and he ordered a Seven and Seven.  Waitress trips off to the bar and returns to tell us that they do not have the first of those Seven's.  Okay.  No problem.  How about Crown Royal instead?  Off she goes again, returning with a small rocks glass containing just the Crown Royal.  Apparently, the second of those Seven's got lost in the confusion.  We called the waitress back and asked for the mixer, which was graciously provided, albeit in a really large glass which diluted the drink to a very weak consistency.    Now, for the food.  I had the Eggs Florentine Benedict with home fries.  Nicely done, the poached egg was perfect and the ratio of sauce, egg, tomato and spinach was quite good.  Home fries were okay, nothing to write home about but a very acceptable side dish.  Dining Companion had a burger and fries.  Nothing spectacular to recommend either but the burger was a good size and was cooked well.  The fries were crisp, salty and not even slightly greasy.    Altogether, the meal was okay.  Not good enough to have me traipsing way back out there but....good.

We met a group of friends at the Big View Diner for dinner last Friday night.  The exterior of the restaurant alone is impressive.  Then you walk in and you're even more impressed.  It reminds me of a 60s diner (not to be mistaken with a chrome-saturated 50s diner).  There is a lot of dark wood used, the writing/signage is an Art Deco font, and the booths seem to be a high-quality leather.  You might find the cast of TV's "Mad Men" at Big View Diner.    There's a large bar/lounge area when you walk in, perfect for having a cocktail before dinner or just hanging out with friends.  Then there's a dessert case and bakery where you can stare at the endless, delicious possibilities.    Our party of 9 was seated in a large round booth, which itself is very cool because it really added to the atmosphere.  Looking around, everything seemed very new, neat, orderly, and clean.  I was very impressed.  I loved the 60s retro feel.    Although we had just dined at Ilios Noche (Big View Diner's sister restaurant) the weekend before and I had a gyro/lamb, I wanted it again.  It's rare that I have the option at restaurants to enjoy a gyro and typically only get to savor a really good one at the Greek Festival here in Charlotte.  I ordered the Gyro Platter instead of the Gyro Pita sandwich.  What's the difference?  Well, I thought it was just that I was getting a Greek salad on the side for only about $1 extra.  Turns out the gyro on the platter doesn't come with anything on it but the meat, so I basically ended up putting a lot of the Greek salad inside of it...which is almost what the gyro pita sandwich is, minus the kalamata olives and feta cheese.  Next time, I'll probably just go with the sandwich that already includes lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki sauce.  The meat was delicious, though.  It was sliced thick, whereas the gyro from Ilios Noche contained chunks of lamb.  I ordered some extra tzatziki sauce on the side, both for the sandwich and as a dipping sauce for my fries (which also had good flavor).    The service was very good, and everyone at the table had a great time and enjoyed all of their dinners.  There was a lot on the menu from which to choose, so it seemed like just about anybody could find at least one thing they'd like.  (I must note here that the meatloaf dinner someone ordered looked fantastic and very hearty!)  When we go back for dinner sometime, I'd also like to try the NY "Disco" Fries as an appetizer.  They sound heavenly.   I think the next time we go back to Big View, it will be for breakfast, though, first.  Isn't that what diners are for?  The breakfast options on the menu look very diverse, and the pricing is extremely reasonable.
Great normal american dinner. Really nothing more to say. Pretty much everything is good for a dinner.

Great diner food may sound simple but this place has a dish for everyone in your family.  I like the Greek food like the lemon chicken, which is delicious, or the spinach spiral pie, which is like a spanikopita but larger size.  Their burgers are tasty too. I also have tried the breakfast food and think it's super.  If you need to find a place where everyone can order a different type of food, this is your diner.  I have not tried the milkshakes, but they are huge and look yummy.  Their beer and wine list is good too.
good food good service chicken n waffles are good. n my wife ordered southwest chicken wrap she loves it.

Came after soccer camp to enjoy the advertised family meal deal on Tuesday, and they claimed it was not available. Disappointed and won't come back. I've eaten there before, and the food is fairly good. Service is average.

The very best without out a doubt.  Have dined here at least 20 times.  Always fresh hot and delicious.  Consistent always perfect and very reasonable prices.  Ownership on premise working it.  Great breakfasts lunch dinners!

I like this place, but don't go very often. Not sure why. The bakery items are huge and amazing. The menu has a wide selection with very large portions and good flavor. There pancakes are great. The Hot Coco is always served hot!!!  It isn't a place I would go for dinner, but they do a good job with breakfast and lunch.

When you step into The Big View Diner it's like you stepped back in time. The place is retro but still current. Very cool! The menu is huge so be prepared! Loads of stuff to choose from and the serve breakfast all day. Our meal was good. Salmon was a bit over cooked but still very tasty. The beef brisket stroganoff was excellent and the manicotti was also good. Service was also good. Someone was always coming by asking if we were ok and needed anything.

We're regulars here. It's had some up and downs, but is a solid diner with a large menu and good portions. The lunch specials are awesome! I really enjoy the sesame salmon sandwich. They make their salad dressings in house- you've got to get the creamy basil. I always have my go to menu items here, I just wish the breakfast menu was a little larger.

I went to the Diner on a suggestion from a friend, and I was surprised afterwards to find a lot of poor reviews on Yelp and other sites by people who had gone there for dinner. The menu is quite extensive and really has something for everyone. While I've been told by fellow diners that some of the more "homestyle" dishes (ones that you usually only let your mom make for you) left more to be desired, I've found most of the typical restaurant/bar food to be excellent! The sweet potato fries and brisket cheese fries are to die for! The salads (particularly the cold plate!) are also really good. Plus, the sandwiches are all well-made and worth the price. They also have pretty decent drink specials (especially for beer drinkers) and they make a point to carry a lot of local brews on tap. The bar manager is a great guy and definitely takes care of you! The only time I had an issue, which involved tweaking a dish on their menu, and the food came out wrong, the manager had them fix the food AND take it off the bill, which was surprising but very nice! Overall, I think this is a great restaurant for dining with friends or just catching a quiet drink :)

Over the years, we've tried several times to like this place. Each time, we were disappointed.  We decided to give it one more shot this morning for breakfast, our favorite meal. Unfortunately, this was our worst visit yet.  It started out ok - we were seated promptly, although we did wait for a bit for a hostess. Our waitress came over and rudely said "what do you want to drink?". No standard "hi my name is so and so and I'll be taking care of you today". After plopping our drinks on the table, we had to point out that we didn't have silverware, cream, or sweetner. Time to order. She plops a notepad on our table and begins writing - a big no-no from my experience as a waitress. We don't see her again and have to ask for a coffee refill (for which they took my cup away to refill - do they not have carafes??). Husband never got a refill.  Our food comes out we dig in. Potatoes were dry and flavorless, eggs weren't cooked throughly, bacon was mostly fat. But the worst was the biscuit. Hard and so dry it broke into crumbs when we cut into it. And it tasted awful.  Bill was plopped on the table with no thank you from the waitress. But by that time our minds were made up - NEVER AGAIN.  This area has so many good places to eat, any of which are better than Big View.

This place has so much potential to be wonderful, but just lacks the wow factor. The desserts, which are displayed at center stage of the place, tasted old and just bland.  The food was okay, but nothing to write home about. The service was just so-so. Half of the restaurant was empty when we went and there was still over a 15 min wait for a table. I just was not impressed. We will not return.
Went here for lunch today and waited 45 mins for two burgers to come out,tea glasses went empty while we were waiting and never refilled until we asked,doubt I would come back.

The food at their restaurants might be great (our neighbor thinks Big View is very good) but don't order a gift card online on their site unless you want the world to know your credit card information. When I ordered a gift card for our neighbor, not only was the site not secure (I did not notice at the time) but the confirmation email they sent had all my credit card information fully exposed in it: number, expiration, even security code. To top it off they did not even send me my card nor respond to my emails asking about the status or exposing my credit card information. At least they did not charge my card, but now half the underworld know my number and would have charged my card had I not cancelled it and got a new number. I hope the service in their restaurants is better than this!

More a restaurant than a diner.  Restaurant is comfortable and clean.  Servers are friendly and efficient.  Food is much more in line with a restaurant, than an inexpensive diner.  Big View is marketed as a New York Diner, and, as a former New Yorker, I can attest it meets that mark - especially at the way in which they price their offerings.  I think it's a little too pricey, when compared to their southern counterparts.  If you visit, you must try one of their spectacular desserts...especially the cheesecake.

Not your standard diner. Fresh, homemade, unique food for a good price. Our server Marcus was very attentive. Decor is really nice. Fresh doughnuts and cakes. My wife had the spinach pie made with a light phyllo dough (excellent), and I had an omelet with a side of large homefries crisped perfectly. We will be back for sure!

I took my daughter and 6 of her friends here for her 17th birthday. They had a great time celebrating. The food was perfect for everyone. Each girl got to order what she wanted, salad, breakfast, pasta, etc. A great place for large groups with all different taste buds.  The bakery made a delicious cake to finish our meal!
I haven't been there in a long time but the food is great. Nice staff: my only downside is they took the tuna sandwich off the menu a while back but still awesome
They have clam chowder on Sundays - best I've ever had! Kids can eat breakfast for dinner which is great for my pickiest.  Overall great food and staff! We will try again!

I was in here on 1/6 and ate at the counter!  Watched kitchen in action and the "manager" that was putting finishing touches on food---sauces, gravy, parsley etc!  Manager was a tall guy with dark hair looked to be early 40??  Anyway with each plate he used this towel that was lying there and wiped plate around the edges--I then saw him use that same towel to wipe his hands and counter with!!!  UGGG!  Kept waiting for John Quinones guy from What Would You Do to pop out and ask me why I was not speaking up!!!  So disgusting will never return!  Unclean kitchens and staff should not be on open display when that display is just in bad taste!  This manager was also checking his txt messages every few minutes and then complained about a couple of customers that wanted to share a plate!!  Told waitress----get rid of them!!!  This guy needs to go!!!
Food and service very good.   Overall we love decor but place is getting run down.   Many seats have large  tears which look terrible.   I hope they fix this ASAP.

This was our first visit in quite a long time.  They have a new menu and finally serve b-fast foods after 11am.  I noticed that they finally have added quite a few "comfort foods" that you would expect to find at a place that calls itself a diner.   On this visit, I had the Spanish omlette  (which I had also tried on a previous visit).  It has corn, black beans and chicken cooked in a mole sauce... Yummy! The potatoes were fresh and cooked just right with just a hint of crispy goodness.  It was served with toast.  I like the coffee here as well. David had a bagel with cream cheese & salmon - which was good except they forgot the capers.  On this visit, there was a 20-30 minute wait for a table, so we opted to eat at the bar.  The service was good and overall we were pleased with our visit. We'll be back to check out some of the other new menu items!

What's the big deal on Big View?  It seems to be polarizing, and I fall into the fanboy half. Our server, James, was entertaining without stretching too far to make jokes. I thought his recommendations on the food were helpful, and he seemed to know quite a bit about the extensive menu (a near overload of breakfast, comfort, Greek, sandwich, and salad choices).  I got a gyro, and even though I have a limited experience of the Greek sandwich, it was delightfully cheap and delicious with a side of cole slaw. It might be the dressing or vegetables in it, but I thought their cole slaw was a step up from most places.  The atmosphere is very busied, and the decor is not your typical diner glint and kitsch. Instead of newspaper clippings or plastic flowers, they have a very 60s looking dining room. Round booths, globe lanterns, and metallic chandeliers: it looks like a trendy restaurant in a Pixar movie. The food is pretty great, but a lot of my praise comes from how grand of a setup a diner can have, so maybe that's where the Big View comes in.  It's a little more upscale than Denny's, but this is a very kid-friendly restaurant with a more gourmet (and healthy) children's menu. I was surprised to see "spaghetti tacos" and edamame pasta next to the ubiquitous chicken fingers.  You absolutely must save room for their award-winning dessert case. They have house-specialties like baklava and ice cream, but if you've got the space, go for an over-the-top choice like pineapple-coconut cake or a cannoli cake. You won't be disappointed, and I think I may try to go for just dessert sometime.

Excellent ribs, Caesar Salad, fries, Gryo Platter and complimentary bread.  This is the most upscale and amazing diner I have ever visited, I will not normally eat at diners but this is the exception to the rule.  Service was excellent with two very friendly ladies that were as nice as could be to my son and I.  Very good wine list, they have my favorite 14 Hands Cabernet from Washington State.    Wayne Gorsek Founder INC 500 Hall of Fame Company

Owned by the same group as Nolen Kitchen, Ilios Noche, and Maverick Rock Taco, Big View is the one that stands out most to me. These guys are trying to embrace a dying breed of "diner-style" eats with the combo of the classic bakery alongside the diner burgers, fries, swing-style soda shoppe atmosphere and include a full bar. I grew up with Fuddruckers and Big View is definitely reminiscent.   The food is mediocre. Nothing too out of the ordinary. I tried the Hickory BBQ Burger - standard applewood smoked bacon, onion straws, and bbq sauce. Nothing like I haven't had before. Definitely reliable when in a burger frenzy or in a pinch for something familiar.   What I will say sings foreground for these guys is the bakery. Goodness gracious is it awesome that you can get a gigantic, NY-stle b&w cookie here. The milkshakes (coffee and chocolate has been my favorite thus far) are wonderful. They have tons of cakes, pies, cookies, and so on. The best part is that they are all in the classic display case and a nice glass window so you can see into the kitchen. These guys may not be a 5-star French bakery, but they are cranking out some American favorites that have yet to be less than spectacular, in my opinion. Definitely worth the pilgrimage for dessert.   The interior is pretty big, too. Tons of booth seating, which is always a favorite, bar stools, tables, and a cozy waiting area.   Though these guys are laid pretty far off of 521 outside of Ballantyne, it's worth the novelty of checking it out.

Usually their food is excellent but not on our latest visit.  Veal meatloaf tasted like beef jerky - did not taste anything like meatloaf.  Chicken potpie - huge disappointment and sent it back.  Crust was flour and water (no taste) they put zucchini and  summer squash in potpie, along with just chicken broth and a very few slices of turkey lunchmeat (no creamy inside no potatoes no peas - they need to revisit their recipe).  Turkey dinner was better but don't put turkey on top of potatoes and stuffing and turkey was sliced like lunchmeat.  Broiled seafood dinner was ok, crab cake wasn't very good and had too much seasoning on top of shrimp and fish.  One of the reason people visit your establishment is because they want "comfort food" from diner.  On a positive note, our waitress was excellent.  Maybe we just visited on an off night.

I'm not sure why everyone enjoys this place. The service is mediocre and the food is not seasoned well at all. Below par for the company. Desserts are hit or miss too.  Great concept just poorly executed.

Ok, as other have  said the service is not always the greatest.  I have been 5 times, and two of times I had bad service.  But the food and bakery are pretty good.  On appetizers, the calamari is some of the best I have ever had, it is succulent.  The chicken pop pie is good also.  Prices are reasonable for the amount of food give, and the atmosphere is nice.  This is one of my favorite restaurants regardless of the sometimes poor service.  Also they have something called a movie night for kids where they show all the kids a movie in another room while the parents enjoy themselves, not totally sure how it works but its an awesome concept.
Absolutely the worst food ever... I'm sorry as someone from New England I just can't stand this!
Good food, but pricey. Nice service. Not up to the standards of a NJ or Long Island Diner.

The food at Big View is decent but the service is slooooooooow. Like, unbelievably slow. Not just during one visit, but on all of them. My parents also agree, they started going to Big View in hopes of something similar to the NY/NJ diners they were used to, and quit going because everything took way too long. Very disappointing.

Not sure how to rate... If I had done my review on Friday, my first visit, I would have definitely give 5 stars! I was in the area and popped in and bought 2 confetti donuts and 2 apple fritters. They were EXCEPTIONAL!!! So much so, I planned a return visit with my family for Sunday. I purchased 8 donuts to take home. When we sat down with tea in hand, these sent me into total SHOCK! They tasted NOTHING like the light airy donuts from the previous version. These were dense and heavy but not cake heavy, just off. I was really taken a back as it's quite a ride to Ballantyne from Harrisburg and about $18 for 8 donuts.  They do offer a punch card 1 free for every 6. Of course, I forgot to present it the second time around. Not sure if or when I might do a redemption visit but they offer an extensive menu of items which includes breakfast all day.

This is one heck of a diner. Their menu is expansive! From southern comfort, to all day breakfast, to Italian, to Greek...they got it all. And at the ginormous portion that one would expect from a diner.   Tried their apps - their hush puppies were great, and the spinach/artichoke dip was probably the gooyest cheese I have ever had. The entrees come with a huge portion of salad, and by the time the actual entree came, I was too stuffed to eat anymore.   Make sure to save space for desserts. They do taste as great as they look on display at the diner entrance.

4-5 stars for service but that food is dismal. Wow. French toast is not that difficult but wow. Challah bread is yellow not white. The bread is the main thing that can make a break French toast. Then the custard has to be right with the correct amount of saturation. Big View Diner has it all wrong. It was painful because the server was trying her best to excuse the lackluster FT dish. To be honest, the southern USA has issues on how to make a decent Challah bread anyway. Oh well...Nyc here I come again for FT!

Big View is a great bakery and restaurant. I have enjoyed everything I have ordered from there. I especially am a fan of the corn beef hash. I would say it tends to be busy and can be a little dirty looking because they are not bussing fast enough. But other than that,I do not turn down a trip to BVD.

In the past I have taken the place for granted as a good spot for breakfast or a burger and fries but yesterday I dropped in for lunch and ordered their meat/fish and two sides for under $9. I had the salmon and spinach/garlic plus their mixed vegetables. It was all great and a real value; the spinach/garlic was good as it gets and their mixed vegetables turned out to be asparagus spears, grilled sliced squash, grilled sliced zucchini, and roasted peppers. Not your usual peas and carrots mixed vegetables. Salmon piece was extremely generous. All said they certainly are much better than I ever had at a "dinner" and I am not sure how they do it for the price. As to those folks who wrote reviews pointing out failings in their service I would say please try them again as you are a missing a Charlotte gem. My service was flawless but service sometimes depends on just luck.

I have been to Big View Diner on several occasions now.  My husband and I have been to watch football games, eat dinner and grab bakery items to go.  Each time we have been we have left satisfied.  The menu prices are a little on the high side, but the food is always great and you can usually find a drink special or two.  The deserts are amazing and I am not sure why I haven't tried them before this week.

Excellent food, wonderful service, Good Specials! The first thing you'll notice when you walk into The Big View Diner is all of the desserts in the case.  They are THE BEST!  There is a Chocolate Cake Type Concoction that is 14.99 and if you finish it, then it's free!  I asked my waitress and she said that no one had ever been able to finish it, so maybe this is one for the Man Vs. Food or something.  The menu is fresh and up to date.  Honestly, my wife asks to go here just about every time we go out to eat.  I believe that she has stock in The Big View that I don't know about or something.  According to her, whatever you're craving, they have it on the menu.  I can honestly say that I've never gone away disappointed, or hungry for that matter.  The only complaint that I have is that the salad dressings that they have are the weirdest concoctions I've ever heard of.  For example, you can' t get an Italian dressing that isn't creamy.  It's creamy with some other things mixed in with it.    The owners are so friendly.  I don't think I've ever eaten in the place without them coming around the dining room to see how everyone is doing.  The prices are reasonable, also.  The decor is befitting of an "Old School" diner.  They really put a lot of time and effort into it.  It's not like a cheesy Applebees or something with all of the weird knick-knacks on the wall.
I'm avoiding dairy and soy due to nursing a baby with an allergy. The manager at big view was so helpful and really went out of his way to make me a great meal. Our server was great as well.

I didn't grow up going to diners. Some restaurants in Southern California may say it's a "diner" but it's more of a concept than true execution of a "classic American diner" - so my review is going to be somewhat of a "diner neophyte."    My husband and I tried Big View for a couple of reasons - it's close by and their throwback-classic-diner-style sign was appealing to us.    We were pleasantly surprised.  The menu is large - there's something for everything and the portions are huge!  I ordered the open face brisket sandwich and my hubby ordered the chicken souvlaki platter.  Both were delicious.  The brisket was tender and flavorful.  The portions were so big that we debated - for a brief moment - whether or not we had room for dessert - but who can resist that amazing bakery!  We ended up with the Vanilla Raspberry Napoleon and it was a perfect ending to our meal.  I look forward to our next visit - maybe for breakfast!

If you are looking for a kid friendly restaurant and menu this is the place to go.  They have everything and it is good old home style cooking like your Mamma makes !  The portions are huge so you can take left overs home for later.  They have a bakery there also. The restaurant is very large and take large groups like soccer teams etc.  The wait staff  are very nice and courteous. Be careful easy to over eat.
Every Single Time .... Delicious food + excellent service + affordable prices = best place to eat  two thumbs way up

We were here last Saturday night for late dinner, service was great,the food,not so much.  The atmosphere kinda reminds me of cheese cake factory. Their menu is like the combination of Cheesecake Factory and IHOP.  My bf ordered the chicken paillard,and I ordered the Greek meze platter and a piece of pancake.   The pancake was really tasty and it's served with warm syrup,I would definitely order them again.   My bf liked his dish, it's grilled herb spiced chicken with jasmine rice and arugula salad,   My Greek platter, however,  I didn't enjoy it much. The chicken "kabob" is basically 2 pieces of grilled chicken and its seasoning is not great and a bit too salty for me.
