The red pepper feta spread is meh, and the tzatziki sauce is a bit too tangy too. The pita bread is also too flat and almost crispy like pita chips. The Greek salad that comes with it is pretty good , other than that I didn't like anything on my plate.   I think I will give them another try next time, hopefully it won't be disappointing again.

Last night's service was horrible from the food to the service. Definitely not I've been accustomed to. The Chicken and Waffles for both my wife and I were bland with little bacon bits and the waffles were very doughy and soft with little taste. The service by our waitress was unpleasant, unfriendly and awkward. The last couple of trips to Big View Diner has been like this trip in regards to the food so we'll hold off from visiting until they bring their service and standards up. Very disappointed in Big View Diner.  Xenia Hospitality reached out to me as a show of PR but we're absolutely uninterested in hearing my comments about how they're processes could be better and have validated that real customer service is a ruse. Don't be fooled.

Big view diner has a large menu, which makes me a little skeptical.  Anyway I tried the Crispy Zucchini Fries with sriracha ranch for appetizer.  I don't like zucchini but I really enjoyed these fries.  They are fried strips of zucchini and the sriracha ranch made them taste even better.  I like the sriracha ranch a lot.  For the entree I had the maple dijon chicken without the bacon with fries.  The chicken sandwich has swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato and maple dijon glaze.  I like the sandwich a lot.  The dijon flavor gave the chicken sandwich a lot of flavor.  The fries were good as well and I ordered another side of the sriracha ranch to dip everything in which gave it an extra kick.  At the end I ordered a oreo cookie shake.  The shake was not good at all because it was runny and not thick at all.    Overall this place is good and I would go back.  The service was really good as well.
This is my spot! They use gulf shrimp here!!! The food is just good! The desserts are good. It's always consistent. Don't sleep on Big View!

The host's desk does not seem to have trained personnel.  They kept us waiting though no other customers needed their services.  Then they seated my young daughter and me in the bar section; do they not like children?  When we returned to be reseated, they said they were cleaning a table for us (there were lots of free tables), then finally sat us in a booth.   The head hostess seemed so cold toward us; the others were nicer.   Lots of bad bodings even before we're were seated!   Luckily the food was OK (the napa salad was actually great!).  The waitress was good and fixed our problems quickly.  I hope they improve their front personnel.

Went for lunch yesterday.  It was after 1:00 and they were not busy.  Server took my drink order.  it was probably a good 15 minutes before she took our food order, mind you we are on our lunch break.  In fact, the other person dining with me had on her work badge.  We finally received our food and no one came to check on us until it was time to bring the check.  Food was good but service sucks.  Please do not go if you are on your lunch break and have to get back to work.  We were both late due to the slow service.

Nice diner with lots of food options. Have had mostly good service staff every time I have frequented the establishment. Have maybe one let down out of the multiple times I've been. I go on many dates here and would recommend.

Seven of us here for an early dinner (4:30)  Couldn't have asked for better service and the food was really yummy.  Chicken soulvaki, corned beef, chicken parm, brisket stroganoff, kids' meals - all were tasty!  Had chocolate cake and cheesecake for dessert to share...........took 4 doggie bags home with enough leftovers for lunch tomorrow!  Will definitely be back - come early, it started filling up at 5:30.

I love the atmoshere, the menu is pretty extensive and the food is good.  It's family friendly and we had a great time here on my husband's birthday.  The bakery in the front of the restaurant is nice too.  I ordered take-out twice and my order got messed up so the staff isn't quite 100%.  That was the only downside.

Food is awesome here! The cocktails are surprising good, and they're fairly accommodating of vegetarians. The Mac and cheese is my favorite and the portion is so big that you could eat it for three meals! Big View isn't your typical diner.

Huge menu with lots of choices! I ordered the balsamic chicken which was delicious...asparagus, goat cheese and balsamic made the dish! My boyfriend had the thyme chicken. It was dry and stringy and his plate was chipped.  When he told the waitress she laughed and asked if we wanted the dessert menu (?) The manager then came by and asked how everything was. Same response oh thats unsusual...sorry. Nothing more than that! He ended up eating the rest of my food.

Ok so we went back to give Big View another chance--- Home Run this time, service was great, bartender served us on the patio did an awesome job. Frank the owner came out and greeted our family. As always the food was great.  So with this visit we again rate Big View with five stars.   Thank you Frank and staff
If you want good bread and some decent soup then this is the place to go. For food, don't bother.

Pros: * they except reservations *friendly waiters  * a lot of options on the menu *serves breakfast all day   Cons:  * not the cleanest * food was okay.  In my opinion, the food was quantity over quality.

We were traveling through and stopped at this diner as a party of 3. We waited over 10 mins, meanwhile many tables were empty. We were seated and our order was taken promptly. When our food came the portions were pretty large but the food was expensive ($14 for a chicken and rice dish). The food tasted okay, my chicken was good but the corn and rice were not so good. I think I could find a cheaper option that tastes better.

Been here for Breakfast, ordered take out for lunch in the past and just had dinner here.  Big View Diner has a very unique architectural design. When we first drove by it, it was like a building from the 50' or 60's. It is from a different time frame. You really want to stop and check out the place.   Yes, this is a diner but more of a fine dining aura. As you walk in the door you are greeting by two hostess in the center. To the left is the bar area and to the right is the display area of all the cakes and deserts. It's like a bakery. We had a slice of the opera cake (definitely to be shared by two).  As for dinner entrees, there was a good selection to choose from. We really lucked out this evening. Two delicious entrees.   -Beef Stroganoff- the brisket blended with the dill and the creamy sauce they used made it so scrumptious. Just brings back memories of my travels to Eastern Europe. Like something rich and hearty when I was in Budapest and had authentic Hungarian Goulash.  -Spinach pie- feta cheese drapped all over the spinach  and to end the evening off with a gigantic slice of Opera Cake. Too bad no Cappucino nor Expresso.

It held great promise, had a great menu and sincere servers, but failed miserably in delivery.  The kitchen is very disorganized with meals coming out willy-nilly.  Save yourself the agony of watching tables seated after you getting and even completing their meals before yours arrives.  Despite your continually apologizing server, they are helpless when it comes to getting your meal out in a reasonable time.  Ahhhhhhhhh!  Went here for breakfast and dinner.  Same-o same-o.  One of the culprits appears to be Hector, who just can't get things right the first time.  In our case I ordered an omelet, my wife blue berry pancakes.  Could it be any more simple?  Apparently not, as Hector completed my omelet, putting it on the heating plate and heat lamp window as he prepared pancakes without the blueberries.    Well, when the error was pointed out by our server, Hector re-did the pancakes, but they were raw in the centers and my omelet, that had been sitting on the hotplate for well over 20 minutes had the cheese melted to oil by the time it was served.  But the plate was hot, so hot that the server could not pick it up from the tray without napkins to shield his hands.  We had been seated for 40 minutes when our meals arrived and were too hungry and too angry to do much more that wave off the server's apologies and eat our meals.  Not good.  Oddly enough we did not suffer enough abuse, so returned for dinner with our son, his wife and two grandchildren. Why, you ask?  Because the menu had everything for everybody and it is a noisy, busy place perfect for children.  OK...ditto the breakfast experience, but we had wine, beer and booze, so that took the edge off of our frustration.    Food is just OK, but hey!...It is a diner, so what do you expect? Gourmet it ain't.  whether Hector was there or not, I did watch and there was a white-jacketed supervisor or coordinator of sorts , but apparently he must be part of the Hector Club of incompetents, so no help for the hungry.  A shame as it could be a great place.  We might try it again, but most likely not.  With the 10s of thousands of "Hectors" coming into the area it would be our recommendation to fire Hector and hope for a better replacement.  As for the kitchen supervisor, knock his nuts together to hopefully get his attention and motivation to get the kitchen to follow some form of order.

This is a place where you will find something that you like regardless if you're a picky water. The smell of fresh baked bread is instantly smelled as soon as you walk in. The breakfast, lunch, and dinner us all good! They have a dessert bar and let me tell you how good is it. We ordered my sons birthday cake from here. We ordered a Ghirradeli chocolate cake that was to die for. This place will keep doing well because if the quality.

Big View Diner in worth it! But the wait can definitely be long :( they are busy throughout the day, and the service is decent. Their breakfast is the best out of everything! I usually get the same thing ( for breakfast) which is the grilled cheese with bacon, egg, and American cheese, but once I ordered it and the toast came out burnt!! The waiter tried to tell me that it always comes out like that, and she had an attitude!  Overall besides that incident, Big view is a good place to dine.

We've been to the Big View Diner before but normally later in the day.  Have an early Dr. Appointment so we were out earlier than normal.   We walked in a few minutes after 8am and they were already busy.  Hostess immediately seated up and brought us menus and took our coffee orders.  She was back in a couple minutes with two cups of outstanding fresh brewed coffee and asked if we has made up our minds on Breakfast.  My wife order Crab Cake Benedict with a side of fruit. Been awhile since I have had Lox and Bagels so the fresh salmon bagel with cream cheese, tomato, onion, and capers sounded close enough  While we waited we reviewed the room. Lots of glass and dark wood, very modern design. It's a good restaurant and has a great fresh bakery section.  By this time our breakfast had arrived.  Serving portions are large and probably explains why I need to loose about 10 extra pounds.  My wife enjoyed her Crab Cake Benedict. Fruit was good and was a lot more than just cheap melon that some restaurants serve. The Benedict's were large and very flaky with a lot of crab and very little filler. They were very large and my wife ended up taking one home for later.  The Salmon and Bagel was excellent. Salmon had a nice fresh taste. The tomatoes tasted like a tomato should and the capers were a nice contrast.  In the end, a very enjoyable meal and we would come here more often except for the commute from Lake Norman is about 30 miles. She's already hitting me up to come down for the lunch menu so she can get the Veal Meatloaf.

Came her for an early Saturday lunch after a pop warner football and I'm so glad we did. We've been here before for breakfast but have never tried lunch.   I had the Thanksgiving Turkey plate and it did not disappoint. Yummy slices of sage seasoned turkey placed on top of creamy mashed potatoes, brioche herb stuffing and all of it smothered in a flavorful gravy. It was truly all the smells and taste of Thanksgiving which also included a side of chilled whole berry cranberry sauce.   The kids enjoyed their all day breakfast menu along with large muds of hot chocolate. So if you ever want an adult meal but the kids want simple and good food, this place will offer something for everyone.  PS the cakes on display at the front counter look and smell amazing.

We truly only go here because their kids menu is impressive.  Where else can you get baked salmon off the kids menu.  As for everything else, well it's just ok.  To date I have had the fish sandwich, which was dry and lacked flavor, and the southwest salad, this was good.  I have yet to try breakfast, which is served all day.  That's a plus.

I've gone about five times now for some Sunday lunches and was only pleased once in all those times.   Like some of the reviewers, I'm originally from the north where diners are nice and plentiful but I was looking for a good diner in SC. The food here was always ok to just bland (save for their french fries which were always good). The one thing I got that was amazing was a bbq burger that they removed from their menu for some reason.    Service has always been terrible. You'll stand around waiting to be seated for a long time and by the time you sit the servers take 15 minutes to greet you and you'll only see them maybe 3 more times from there. The day I had the bbq burger the air conditioner was dripping (it dripped on me a few times) and their solution was to have their dish boy mop the vent over the customers. A lot of dust came off those vents despite the condensation.   Their prices are also a little higher then other restaurants. For the price and quality you might as well go to a chain restaurant.

We have eaten breakfast lunch and dinner here. Food is great and they don't mind us picky eaters with substitutions and special cooking instructions. I've yet to try the desserts but hear they are to die for.

BIG VIEW is our go to Diner for all ages. Everything is made in house right down to the bun on your burger at a reasonable price. We have eaten here since it opened. We have never had a soggy chicken parm, or a single piece of old lettuce. Nothing but quality comes out of this kitchen and the staff is excellent. My favorites are chicken and waffles, fried zucchini,  the big Greek salad, and their fresh made cannoli. They also have an amazing bakery that you can get just about anything you want from! If they don't make it you can bring them the recipe and they will make it especially for you, because they aim to please. That's what I like about this place. They are all about the customer and if god forbid something were to go wrong it seems they would go to their grave to make it go right for you. Love this place!

This used to be 4 stars, but unfortunately the food quality has really dropped in the last couple of years.  The corned beef hash is still awesome and the selection of desserts is good, but most recent dishes I have tried are not what they used to be.

We waited 45 minutes for a booth on a Saturday night. Both bars had open seating. We started with the Kung Pao Calamari and it was awesome!  Very tasty and they gave us chopsticks :) fun! Our waitress was friendly and witty at first. Then as she had to cover a party of 10, she became laser focused on their needs and neglected us completely :( Our meals came missing items promised and we waited for quite a few minutes to have them retrieved. Drink refills took a couple requests per refill. (But she kept them coming for the table of 10! I felt like taking our glasses to their table) My turkey Reuben was ok... it was thick sliced turkey meat instead of deli meat which would have been preferred. I would not order it again for sure.  The sweet potato fries did not live up to the waitress's description and I wouldn't order them again either. My hubby got the Challah french toast which was good but it doesn't compare to the Midnight Diner's french toast. He enjoyed the grits and said that the scrambled eggs with cheese were "alright". The apple smoked bacon was too crispy and not memorable. The decor was pretty interesting and unexpected as you walk inside. Not your typical diner decor! Despite the obvious issues found on this visit, we will return and try them again. The menu is vast and we would like to give it a few more tries!

I visited big view diner for third time tonight and have to say I was very disappointed in the food.  I think there was not even 2 ounces of meat in my stroganoff and what was in there was tough and stringy.  For what I paid for it, I expected it to be good.  It was definitely a letdown and made me think the extra 20 minute drive I took to get good food should be in another direction from now on.  3 pieces of mushrooms and a tiny piece of what was called "brisket" was definitely not worth it.  Service was great which was only reason I put 2 stars!  Too bad food didn't match.

As always enjoyed the great diverse menu and the friendly service.    There's something for everyone.  From fresh pastries and juice to biscuits and gravy and chicken and waffles if you have a breakfast favorite chances are you can find it here.  Only drawback is that the massive post church rush on Sunday's makes it tough to get a seat without a wait.   By far the best breakfast place in South Charlotte

We've been here many times and every single time has been great.  What I love the most is that the menu is so diverse that everyone in my family of 5 can always find something that they like.  Although my boys ALWAYS have the chicken and waffles.  I tried something different this time: salted caramel sweet potato french fries.  Now these things are so rich that you have to share them. 3 people easy.  Delicious.  If you don't like sweet, don't even go there.  My husband had the seafood platter for his meal which he said was okay, but he raved about the calamari we had for an appetizer.  We order calamari at every restaurant we go to and he said this was the best he's ever had.  It's just the rings, flash fried in a sweet and spicy sauce.  Sarah was our server and she was so engaging, professional and helpful with the menu.  Almost forgot about the made from scratch desserts.  Great family restaurant.

This place was so great when it opened. We went there very often, and then the food and service started to go downhill, so we took a break. Well, we went back tonight, after about 10 months and our server was great...attentive and friendly.  However, the food left a lot to be desired. The hamburger was served cold, as were the fries.  The chicken parmigiana was cooked to the point where it was chewy and dry...more like chicken parm jerky!  The plastic covered menus are dirty and falling apart.  Peeling plastic piece fell on the table when I opened my menu.  All in all, it was a disappointing experience, and we will probably be on a permanent break from going there this time.

Stopped by for the 2nd time on Friday with my sister and my nephews because the 6 y/o stated he wanted grilled cheese and not our normal pizza and we knew they had it from the last time we were there.  We were sat right away.  Our server wasn't the friendliest but she made sure drinks were refilled and she stopped by a few times to check on us.  I tried the Californian chicken sandwich this time and it was really good.  It was basically chicken with roasted vegetables and melted cheese on an onion roll.  The roll was soo good, it was soft and chewy and I liked it a lot.  The bread they bring to the table is good too, 2 rolls and 2 pieces of cornbread, all warm and very tasty.  Kids enjoyed their grilled cheeses, but my sister was not happy with her BLT, it came with cheese on it which she didn't know and she is lactose intolerant, and it had hardly any bacon.  Also, we opted to do salads instead of fries with our meals and our server said it was an upcharge to substitute and we said fine.  When we got the bill it wasn't an upcharge they just charged for a regual salad, thought that was a little lame.

Visited this restaurant with my sister for only the second time as I haven't been to Charlotte lately. It was as good the second trip as it was the first. Our wait for a table on Sunday morning was about 30 minutes, but this gave me time to review the menu and peruse the bakery case. Once seated we received great service and food, but the cold draft flowing from the air vents in the ceiling was uncomfortable enough that I went back out to my car on a drizzly and cold day to get a jacket. This is why I can't bring myself to give 5 stars, because I am not a polar bear. After a flavorful meal, I did purchase several pastries to bring home. Fantastic stuff!! The peppermint scones were Out Of This World fantastic. Crave worthy!
Booths and chairs recently got new upholstery. Looks much better now. Now you can actually bring someone here on a date.

We are regulars in this joint! I'd say there are days when orders and food are perfect and days when things are out of hand, but nothing really major mistakes! Little details that we always let it go! you can't always complain when there's nothing wrong with the taste anyway!   I always get the Salmon, I have given up on some of their items on the menu as they do not seem appealing to me look and taste wise! but the salmon, they can't exactly ruin it? if they do- well, I better find another place, right? The Devilled Eggs, nothing you can ruin either! simple boiled egg, and mix the yolk with a lil touch of mayo, dash of pepper and so on and on.. simple! but yesterday's Devilled egg? OH MY GOD! It's like eating a snot, no flavor, whatsoever! Must be the chef working yesterday morning! and the rice? how could you ruin a rice? -- yes by serving me the rice from previous day!   Otherwise, this place is decent! but expensive! :P
Slow service and food is nothing spectacular.  Always busy which seems odd for the food being boring! Too many options may be the problem!

First time here with family. Service was good. The food was not. My lamb gyro wrap was filled with very thin slices of lamb that were over cooked.the side order of onion rings were over cooked. The waitress was kind enough to bring another dish of onion rings, but they to were so crunchy you could chip a tooth. One of our guests had the pot pie and said it was so so. I gave them two stars for service and ambience.

Been here several times and the service was ok. Today my daughter and I were seated at the bar tables and we were the only customers this side. The waiter didn't come to ask for drinks for almost 15 mins. I ordered chop steak, jasmine rice and sautéed spinach, and the rice was hard as rock.  The waiter never came back so I had to as the bartender and talk to the manager. This was 3:30 and the place empty.  Horrible service!

Had not been back in almost a year and was looking forward to the great food and service we had experienced previously.  My first inclination of dread was when I saw the catering van still had the name of restaurants that they had closed.....but in I went. My wife and Granddaughter were already there.  While waiting for a table some people walked in and were immediately seated? When we were finally taken to our table it was in the back of the restaurant where wait staff were constantly walking back and forth with food and drinks and dirty dishes.  My Granddaughter would be sitting in a high chair directly in the path. I told this to the person seating us and asked for another table. I was told that we could not have a booth, with a highchair, because of fire regulations. Side note...ate New Year's Eve at another restaurant at a booth with a highchair! We finally were seated at another table.  Our waiter came by,  took our drink orders and promptly brought them back....well he got one of two right! He took our order and disappeared.  The table next to us filled up with eight people and a wait staff person took their order. Now the wait began....and continued and continued. The table of eight got their food and our wait continued. Finally a runner brought our food....well two out of three. Evidently they didn't read my order correctly and made my Patty Melt with Beef instead of Turkey.  They rushed the refire and my food came out fairly quickly.  Having been in some sort or food service for most of my life I knew the trick...the top bread of my Patty Melt was nice and grilled.....the bottom soft and greasy. The dressing was on two thirds of the bread. I pulled the bottom bread off and ate that half. Thought Patty Melts had Grilled Onions...guess not here. Had Onion Rings instead of Fries.....never seen Onion Rings that dark and crispy... OVERCOOKED! Let's tally up the scorecard.. Drinks 50% correct Food 66% correct ------------------------------ Final Score...It'll be another year before we go back... MAYBE!
The service is always great and so is the food! Love coming here. Keep up the geat work!

We have tried Big View many times over the years and it never improves. Will not ever be back. The bakery looks good but every item we have ever tried has been dry and tasteless. Don't go expecting a yummy diner experience. Save your time and money and go elsewhere.

I was very excited to try this restaurant, but left highly disappointed.  I got a Cesar salad and lobster bisque soup...pretty basic, right? Apparently I was wrong. I am not a picky eater at all, but wow...both of these items were terrible.  I didn't complain and kept trying to eat more thinking maybe it was just me, but then my husband tasted the soup and I have never seen him respond like he did. His response, "that soup is disgusting." Oh and along with my food being terrible and my husband's fries tasting like they were soaked in oil without being cooked, the air conditioning unit consistently dripped onto our table (and the table beside us had another A/C unit drip all over them too).  Mmmm yummmy addition to our food.  Gross. We also had to wait until our food came out before we were given a high chair for our one yr old.  What a nice dinner it was.

We were just driving into Charlotte and decided to stop here for dinner. Had the best Blt ever! It came on grilled sourdough, with avocado and a tangy pesto mayo, Yum! and sweet potato fries on the side ( it also came with a well done egg, but i had them bring it on the side for my doggie)/

The food is consistent, hot and yummy! Service can be spotty but isn't usually a problem. Going on a Sunday morning? Plan to wait a while...Excellent breakfast choices, Try the blueberry pancakes and best grits I've had around the area. Lunch is even better! Side spinach is freshly prepared. Great place, all around.

Went here for breakfast, hoping for actual diner options. I could not be more wrong. Their selections are mainly eggs, with a side of bacon, toast, hash or pancakes. There are one of each main bfast staple: waffles, pancakes and french toast. But again, I don't eat eggs that are not cooked into another dish, so options are really limited here. This place does get crowded on sunday mornings, and as huge as it appears outside, the dining space is small. Also, sitting near the kitchen, I started to get allergic reactions that I normally get from a cat (sneezing, watery / itchy eyes, runny nose). I didn't inquire but why would they tell me the truth since cats aren't allowed in food establishments.

Mediocre food and horrible service. The Big View is obviously the weak link in the Xenia Hospitality Groups' otherwise stellar offerings.    I have been to the restaurant a few times and always leave saying I will not return. I will not repeat the mistake of giving them another chance.  If you are looking for a big plate of food you won't be disappointed as long as you aren't picky about quality and don't mind overpaying for it or the poor service provided.  Two thumbs down Big View.

I have been back a several more times since it's so close to work. The management and staff are very friendly and helpful. I enjoy that they are constantly updating parts of the menu to keeps things fresh. A few of my friends love getting their breakfast items for dinner. Food is also good. I think I was a little harsh when I rated it as only "decent" in my previous review. Finally, they got a really nice bar area and a private room in the back that's great for really large groups and private gatherings.

A Diner with a restaurant identity crisis or is the other way around either way it stands in a VERY good way.   I've put off stopping here purely because of location.  NO LONGER!  I've been missing the diners of NJ and was in the neighborhood.  The growlings of a homesick foodie are put at bay.   The initial pungency of sewer gas/grease trap/trash at the front door (hey, it's summer, in the south. No worse than the smells of Elizabeth, NJ but, notable) was a put off until the gates of baked goods shangri la opened and you are encased in the aroma of cinnamon rolls and whatever goodies were baking this AM.  Not only are you greeted by a host/hostess you are treated to the classic clatter of coffee cups and plates behind the glass case of cakes, pies and pastries (OH MY) had me planning dessert before seeing the lunch menu.    Planning on a burger or club sandwich, you know, "the tell' for any diner worth its chops in the NE (or is it the meatloaf and gravy?). Seated in the middle of the larger dining room (there are two sides) it is minimally decorated, which is a good thing as it focuses you on who you are with, whether it be a book or your lovely spouse, I was with the latter. Not the tome of a menu you expect in a diner but enough to sample from all that you could desire and BREAKFAST ALL DAY! Coffee is elegant and flavorful. I did not have breakfast but, too notice of other plates as they went about the dining room and they looked to be standard: eggs, omelets, bacon , sausage, golden hash browns/ home fries and  thick slices of toast.    We started with the thick cut onion rings. Thick, tender and sweet onion, crunchy and not over battered or greasy served with a savory remoulade that made me want to order another batch as a side.  I opted for the feature of The Skyliner, a pound of (tender) corned beef, (perfectly) roasted turkey and (glorious) pastrami topped with swiss cheese, grainy mustard and horseradish between two slices of first bite to last (yes, I REALLY did eat the whole sandwich) hold it all together, not soggy, airy GRILLED rye bread. My lovely bride chose the steak burger (excellently cooked) bright pink medium. Speechless was the rest of the meal except for the "how is it?' and that was almost ignored. Not a sample bite was offered on either end (wife does not like and to her regret, pastrami or corned beef) and she was enjoying her burger to much for me to risk losing a finger. The fries are crisp and hot and almost an afterthought considering the in house made bread and rolls the sandwiches are served on.  Consider another side from the regular fries, like the sweet potato fries or mixed green salad. The Chef checks on tables in the downtime of his expo. duties and is genuinely interested in your delight.  Dessert was not eaten (I just ate a pound+ of meat and bread come on give me a break) but, the Triple D was considered and will be happening sometime soon. Miranda (our waitress) was knowledgeable, polite, quick and at the end of the meal offered "roadies" of water or coffee.   Well worth the visit and I will be going back for my own burger and the Triple D!!

My family went for a late lunch. We were told 35 mins, but surprisingly only waited 15 mins before being seated.  For a group of 5 the table was a bit small but we made it work.  Menu was limited because it is Easter Sunday. You could not order off the everyday menu. Drink orders came, but after bring it up to my nose it smells like mildew. It was on the cup, and in the ice. Water lines need to be replaced. Yuck. Most likely the soda machine needs to be cleaned out also. Food was really good, but service was very lacking. After we got our food she just disappear. My mom had to track down a to go box.

Sorry to say this place disappointed me.  not a diner over priced underwhelming salty food and poor service.   Would not recommend .  Important to note if the menu is longer than a page. There's probably not much good.   1 star for the thick milkshake.  1 for the great looking desert case.

I hadn't been here in at least two years but decided to take the chance again since we are BIG fans of Ilios Noche - so glad I did!  Decor is loud NJ diner - if you grew up in the Northeast or Chicago it will bring a tear to your eye - loud flour, big bakery case, dinettes and neon as far as the eye can see. Totally over the top but awesome.  Service was brisk (it was Sunday night). We started with a round of drinks and started with the  yuca fries. Served with chimichurri sauce, they were crispy, salty goodness and the sauce was a great accompaniment.   For dinner we covered the vastness of the menu (it has everything from greek to burgers to pasta to salads). I had the lamb gyro platter, my daughter had the sliders and my son had the gluten-free ravioli. All three were excellent - the greek items are straight from the Ilios menu and the attention shows (in particular the pita bread and tzatziki sauce). The ravioli's and sauce worked very well together and the portion was generous. The sliders were pretty much what they were - good size mini burgers served with fries.   We also had a slice of the crazy large chocolate cake - enormous and enough for three to share!  Overall this is a great option if you are with a group and can't settle on what you want - the food is high quality across the board and the decor is fun.

Well, I'm from the NY metro area originally and was hoping to find a northern diner experience here. Although the food wasn't bad, it just lacked that northern Greek Diner touch. The one thing that totally turned me off was them bringing our meals to the table without  them being complete. So I sat there with my burger getting cold, waiting for my french fries. "They'll be out in just a few moments sir."  A manager stopped by to ask if everything was ok, to which I replied, "It would be nice to eat my french fries WITH my burger!"  Bringing meals to the table before they are ALL complete is one of the cardinal sins in the restaurant business.(another one is clearing the table before EVERYONE is done eating).  The burger was tasty and cooked as ordered. The portion of meat was about half the size you would get up north though. Ketchup was provided in a small cup(no bottle on the table) and of course there wasn't enough to finish the fries with. Real diners provide the bottle on the table so the patrons can use as much as they like. DON"T SKIMP on the ketchup for goodness sake!  Although I may seem overly critical, the restaurant is the closest to a diner that we have in these parts. I would not drive half an hour just to go here again, but would come back if I was close by.

Waited over an hour and fifteen minutes for our appetizer. Which was only chicken wings. No refills on our beers. Had to ask and then wait for another half hour. Waited too long that we had to even cancel our main courses and make plans to go elsewhere. Husband ordered the chicken and waffles. Didn't even finish it. Said it was the driest chicken ever. Said he preferred if we would have went to Wendy's. Beer was greater than 1/3 foam for a local craft brew. Mentioned this to the bartender which is where we were sitting and she said they always have foamy taps. She gave us one beer total on the house for the wait, yet charged us for it on the bill. It was Thursday so half price wine bottles. Conveniently sold out of the cheapest/most affordable bottles. First and last time visiting despite living less than 2 miles. We will always be loyal to DBs tavern!!! Never disappointed there.

THE BEST!!! I live in the big apple (NYC), and have visit this diner frequently whenever I go to see my parents who live in Fort Mill. The food is always excellent.  Anyway, my mom & dad both got the flu.  I called all around for take out, and then I remembered this place. Well, the manager, Brittany, delivered 3 large containers of soup to my sick parents.  I just want to say something about Southern hospitality here.  It is everything that they say it is and the BIG VIEW DINER, is living proof.  Thank you Brittany.  You have just made a major investment in Karma.  To ad, all of their soups are made from scratch not cans, and they absolutely have the best burgers around.  All of their deserts are to die for as well.  I am a New Yorker and fussy to the max.  This place gets a 10.

We stopped in for dinner, the menu was good with plenty of choices. I ordered the Dijion Maple Chicken sandwich. Did not taste the Dijion, Maple worst sandwich I have had the chicken was dry and my fries were soggy. The used hickory smoked bacon, instead of maple cured bacon. My wifes food was worst and the chicken she ordered had no taste I mean NO taste. She was trying to eat it and just could not eat it. They maybe able to make breakfast but dinner is not good. There were some older couples there and I asked them about thier food and they were not to happy either, but the one guy said you come here you get ue to it. Well not going back. our wairtress was outstanding and was very attentive to our needs but the kitchen was not plating food that had any taste.  Sorry I know my food and how to cook and the food that was plated for us, I would not even send out of the kitchen.

First time we've been to this restaurant and I must say I wasn't impressed at all. We were seated right when we arrived, but were put at a booth/table which was very close to other people. This would've been fine, except we have a baby and needed room for him. The server arrived promptly and got our drink orders. When it came time to order, she pulled out her note pad which caused her to drop some change. She then proceeded to say we are her last table. I've worked on the industry before and would never tell my table that. My boyfriend ordered a salad. He received it with our meals. The food was ok. He didn't like the sauce for his brisket, it was sweeter than most. Not that big of a deal, but I ordered a wrap. They really should put more meat in their wraps. All of that aside is one thing, but the server never asked if we need anything? At the end of our meal, she didn't even ask if we wanted dessert? She could've gotten more, but she just wanted to get out of there. Which you could tell, especially since she basically was pushing us out the door. We will not return.

This place has taken a turn for the worse. Tables falling apart, booths ripped up, paint peeling from the sides of tables, tape all over--wow. Food has gotten worse, too. Unfortunately, I can't recommend BVD anymore. Hope they can fix it.
Food is just good. The service is good anywhere but in the bar area. Had bad service in the bar area several times.

Always pleased, service is spot on, and food is delish! Can't go wrong with the Greek salad and salmon. Yes, Greek salad in a diner. If you know anything about upstate diners, they make the best Greek salads. Forever I am missing NY and Jersey diners. Everything here is good and fresh to order. Yummy.

Stale blueberry muffin. Asked if I could get one that was made today. The waitress said definitely not. For a place with a bakery, this was a bit surprising. Asked about the fresh squeezed orange juice on the menu- yeah, it comes from a carton according to the waitress. Eggs were good, bacon was ok (not thick, but not totally paper thin). Ordered an English muffin- cane cold and soggy and not buttered. Not great service either..... it was just ok.

I'm a Charlotte native and this is my favorite diner in Charlotte. I stop in anytime I'm in the area. The prices may seem high to some but the portions are generous and the quality is there as well! The service has always been good when I have been. This is a well run diner! Some of my favorite dishes are the turkey dinner, the spinach pie, the pot pie and the balsamic chicken. Of course, all of their Greek dishes are great as well! They have their own bakery so the desserts are to die for!  They have a different soup of the day and drink specials every day of the week. They have lunch specials Monday-Friday 11AM-4 PM.
Went back for lunch/dinner and have to admit that we did not enjoy it as much as we did our first visit....however, the desserts were still outstanding!!!
I really like this restaurant. Large, clean, well lit with a huge menu to appeal to any palate. Soups are delicious and everything is wonderful.

The food here is good. We came for brunch one Sunday and luckily found 2 seats at the counter.   The reason it doesn't get more stars is because of they way they speak to their employees. Servers had to literally drop what they were doing to answer to the owner (?). If they didn't come to him fast enough he yelled louder. Very offputting and offensive. I actually tipped my waitress better because of this.  Making your customers happy is top priority, but so is treating everyone with respect. I was with my young son and I don't think we will be back, unless we are sitting at a table. I didn't like him to hear all of the yelling and the way others were treated.  However, if you do go, get the Spanish omlette.

I've eaten at Big View probably 15-20 times and most of the time the food's pretty good. But I just finished a cannoli from there and had to sign on to Yelp just to tell you it's the best cannoli I've ever had. Whoa, whoa, whoa.

Something that really irks me is unpleasant and poorly run front of the house management. We came here at the recommendation of a friend on a Sunday for brunch and were greeted by two grumpy and rude hostesses. Additionally, there were tons of empty tables and a huge wait, not great for customer morale. After a 30 minute wait we were seated in a booth next 4 empty tables and the hostess didn't say a word to us. The 4 tables were all filled up immediately after we sat. Our waitress was friendly and attentive when she could be, since she was dealing with 5 tables at the exact same time. I ordered the Greek omelette and hubby got French toast with eggs and sausage. They messed up my husband's order but our waitress had written it down correctly and immediately brought out the sausage and eggs which were omitted from the original plating. The food was pretty good, the French toast was very tasty and I really liked my biscuit. I was about to rate this place 3 stars until I went to the bathroom and there was a nasty nasty mess in one of the stalls. I think some training on hostess staff and regular bathroom checks would greatly improve guest experience. Might try again at a less peak hour in the future.

Ordered the Cuban Pork Sandwich. Very dry and not grilled on a press while the pork was flavorless and dry the point I had to add water to it. Flaccid fries were the high point of this extremely poorly prepared "diner" fare.  Was seated in the lounge area near a obnoxiously loud bartender and her drunk friends. Needless to say I will take a bigger view to find a better place.

Ate here for the first time today.  Very eclectic place.  Cool diner with lots of atmosphere.  Plates come full of tasty treats.  Hard to clean them by yourself.  Have already found my next meal on a very full menu of items.  Turkey Burger rocks!

After several visits, the food is consistently on point and the the service from Jamie today was extraordinary!  It's beyond refreshing to see a server that so clearly loves what she does! Hats off to Holly and her team! Keep up the awesome work!

I had never heard of this place, but my boss loves it so he took me when we were in Charlotte on a business trip. To quickly summarize my experience, it was great! Service and food was all top notch. Their menu is quite diverse, so I can almost guarantee you'll find something you'll love. I had the grilled salmon in a reduction sauce with asparagus and mashed potatoes and it was amazing! I got to meet one of the owners, Angelo, and he was a great host. He talked with us most of the evening all while supervising his very busy kitchen. I would definitely recommend giving this place a try if you are in Charlotte.

I am now and forever will be a part of the BIG VIEWER fan club!!! A great selection, perfect size and the desserts are soooo super duper scrumpdillyishous! Whether you want a simple soup and salad, or light and tasty salad with homeade dressing, a sandwhich that eats like a meal, or a nice choice of finger foods, this is the place. Love the party room and the fact they accommodated our large group.  So hard to find restaurants with good food, pretty things to look at, and reasonably priced (given that side of town), not to mention the excellent service.  I also love that the head Chef, Frank walks around to say hello.  I even looked in their kitchen and bakery and knew this was my favorite because the floors were clean.  No employees smoking in fron or on the side of the building and the bathroom, though it was crowded to capacity, DID NOT remind me of a horror movie...... I was happy that my critical group of picky eater girlfriends were all satisfied with he selection and we definitely had a GREAT time....

We've been to this diner a few times since we've moved here and would have to say that the food and service is consistently OK. The bakery by far is the best feature of this place and breakfast is good. We have ordered birthday cakes and they were well made and tasty.

Haven't been in a Long time but It was AMAZING  when I Did dine there. Im not sure why I have not returned however,  I do recall the food being slighty pricey for the items that I ordered.  Hmmmmm Im going tomorrow and hopefully I wont have to come back and change anything!  #FoodWasGoodTho

We were in a celebratory mood (more on this in late March for my fellow Yelpers) and we've always had a good experience here.  However, one of the orders didn't meet expectations.   Overall,  the food was decent (3.5/5) except for one meal which brought the rating down.  That was the Reuben sandwich.  Now, it passed the eye test but did poorly on taste.  The corned beef was too fatty and the thousand island dressing tasted stale as did the bread.  Just not a good example of a classic sandwich.  The other dishes were fine (4/5) I had the steak salad and the beef was very good and the chicken pasta dish garnered good praise.   The service was excellent (5/5) and we had this waitress before and she was consistent and friendly.  We'll dine here again but it may be awhile before we do.

I've eaten at the big view Diner many times.  I love the desserts there . They're large and they are delicious New York style  95% of the time the food is delicious other times I have had cooked  vegetables that were raw, coffee that was cold and   a skirt steak that was tough.   However the majority of the food is well portioned and attractive and served hot. The servers are generally friendly and attentive.   Today we ordered  a  Greek salad , roasted turkey cobb salad a chicken gyro,  lamb pita and New England clam chowder  All entrees and salads were delicious. However the clam chowder was thick and pasty with little clam flavor.  A good menu, reasonable prices and generally good food keep me coming back

Dined here tonight and had a pleasant experience (as usual) Our waitress checked on us when needed, and food was good. I got the Ranchero bowl but there's a variety to choose from on the menu. This place is definitely one of our go-to spots!

Big View is my 'go to' diner. Their breakfast is great. For dinner, I like to get their Gyro. For dessert, I get the cannellonis. Big View has a great bakery. The staff is very friendly and always remembers me.

The service was nice but the food was mediocre at best. The food took a long time to come out even though it was not busy. The salads were pre-dressed with watered down tasteless dressing. Other toppings on the salad were skimpy. All of the food needed seasoning. The prices were very, very expensive for the quality and the quantity. We will not return.

The atmosphere, selection, and prices  are not the Only thing that make this place wonderful! We had the best waiter named Russell and loved the enormous menu choices. This place is amazing. Our food looked so pretty, we Didn't want to eat it. This is definitely my all-time favorite restaurant. From the all day breakfast with red velvet waffles and fresh omellettes, to the walnut crusted salmon and endless desserts. You can not loose at the Big View Diner.!!!!

The most fun thing about this place is the aroma that smacks you in the nose the minute you hit the front entranceway.  Somehow they must vent in those sweet bakery scents, which reminds you that this is a good place for desserts.  Today, however, was about a late breakfast for me and it was very good. A lot of food for the money.  My lunch companion had ordered salmon with mixed veggies, but instead got salmon with sweet potatoes.   They quickly corrected this when we told them.  At the end of our meal, the server asked us to remind him what we had eaten so that he could ring it up.  That was a first for me and I left wondering if this was his normal way of ringing up his orders.  I should have told him I had eaten the stir fried coon.
My boyfriend,  his son & I went here for Father's Day. They had awesome eggs & the server was very attentive. The atmosphere was nice as it was a cross between a diner & a restaurant.
Great breakfast! I like that it looks cartoony, it drives people who judge a book by its cover away. Fast friendly service, and the coffee is actually great. I love Greek run diners

Food was good however service was lacking...  had to get a waiter to get ketchup, steak sauce and ice after our food was delivered to the table.  We ordered a pie to go and waited 15 mins before we went to the front ourselves to pick it up.  Management issues?

Extremely disappointed with my late evening dinner. The veal meatloaf had a tremendous amount of filler which caused the dish to have a grainy mouth feel and a very bad Chef Boyardee meatball taste.  The cannoli cake and strawberry short cake were the highlights of the meal.

Came to this restaurant with no expectations because it was our first visit. We were dressed in casual wear of tshirts but we're still very presentable. As soon as we walked in we got dirty looks from the hostess on our appearance and once we actually sat down we were never served. After 10 minutes of no service or even acknowledgement from the multiple servers that walked past our table serving those around us, we left. I do not recommend this establishment if your hoping for respectable service.

This was my first time here and I loved it! I had the Spanish omelette, hands down one of the best omelette's I have ever had. Our waitress, Jenny was super friendly and adorable. The best time to get there is before 9:30, it's pretty busy. This will definitely be our new Sunday morning breakfast place (sorry OPH).

This is a really cute place! Very eclectic in it's interior. The dessert case to the right of the entrance is very enticing and appears as if the desserts would be great. I believe they are made in house. This place does boast a wait, and aggravating the fact is that they don't give out any hand held devices that buzz when they are ready to seat you, but call your name instead. We waited about 15 minutes early Sunday morning, as this place is very popular. Hubby and I enjoyed our breakfast and our waitress was on top of things the whole time. Our coffee cups were never empty at all.  Hubby went with the Cajun omelet with potatoes. He immediately commented how appetizing it all looked and confirmed that after having a bite of each. I had the eggs Benedict which I had been craving for awhile. I ordered your standard eggs Benedict but was less then thrilled with it, it was just very standard and didn't taste any better then the one my hubby makes for me at home. The potatoes were good, with nice seasoning and bits of onions and peppers to add to the flavor. I also had a side of corned beef hash and that had a spice in it I couldn't identify, but it added a nice flavor to it. We would definitely go back again for both breakfast, and dinner. Hubby and I both love diners and to find a good one is rare, and we look forward to visiting again.

Second Chances are always worth it.  I had eaten at this diner about 6 years ago and did not have a very favorable meal. Never went back and never gave it much thought. Then I was invited to a Baptismal Luncheon there for my Granddaughter. It was in a separate room which was nice and we had a very good server. Food had really been stepped up. I know that it is owned and managed by Illios Noches which I do like, and it seems they have made the food and the service much better. Usually a large group,  which this was , Is hard to take care of of, but it was service on!  I ordered ( from a limited menu) the Chimichurri Steak. I ordered it rare and it was served cooked perfectly. The sauce was very flavorful. It was served with fresh green beans. Everyone ( 26 People ) had pretty good experiences. Desserts were fun and delicious!  So it goes to show you...Second Chances are worth it!
Another incredible meal & service from what has to be the best diner in Charlotte area. The Balsamic Salmon & Argentinian Flank Steak are great. Good service from people who care.

We have always had decent service here and the food has always been good. The variety is the best thing about this place... besides the BAKERY! Holy god, everything from the bakery is heavenly. I gave this place 4 stars out of 5 because a water vent was leaking and dripped on my family and I and we had to request to move; the waitress didn't apologize. Otherwise, we go here often.

Hit or miss...  Food quality isn't consistent.  Took them 3 tries to make a scrambled egg w cheese for my daughter- we just stuck with the dry pancake.  Overpriced.  I wouldn't waste my time here when there are so many different restaurants in the area that are worth the try!!

Collectively my husband and I give this a 4 Star. I've been here before, for a bridal shower. We sat in the "sun room" in the back. It was a nice experience then. On this occasion we sat in the regular dining area. The wait to be seated wasn't that bad, but my husband felt like after we were seated, we waited a while for our waitress to come check on us. The food was good though. My husband got the full house: 3 eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes and pancakes. He's a big eater! I got the banana foster French toast. It was a huge portion, but very tasty! They also have mimosas which are my go to for breakfast! Overall it was a good experience!

order waffle. TWICE IT CAME OUT COLD.  Waitress channel stay away from. Ask to tlak to manager he never came to table. Anthony the manager gave me 9.00 for the waffle. I still went home and cooked myself dinner. Husband was made I complained. Wouldnt you?

Bad service, horrible attitude, and overcharging.   I ordered the smoked sausage breakfast to go; at pick up Alex made me wait and stand over 7 mins while she played with the cash register; when she finished with the register, she charged me a $1.50 up charge for the smoked sausage breakfast which is listed at $7.95 on the menu and online.  I thought that was a little off and showed her where it said $7.95 on the menu for the smoked sausage breakfast; she got the manager. Mgr Ashley started talking very loudly AT me with a condescending attitude and said it was because I wanted smoked sausage in my smoked sausage breakfast (HUH???) that I was assessed an up charge. Then she changed her mind and said it was the poached eggs which were up charged a $1.50 fee. I let her know I've never been charged extra for poached eggs in all the years I've bought from them. Then she acted like she wanted to be magnanimous and do me a favor and give me a discount "just this one time."  No one could show me an up charge for poached eggs on the menu. I asked for a higher Mgr and none was in the restaurant.  I just decided to leave, I wouldn't enjoy the food at that point.

I can't eat somewhere that's not clean and the Sunday I went it was so gross, I haven't returned to eat there. Which is unfortunate because it's convenient location. Their portions are generous & their baked goods are excellent. I have special ordered desserts - especially pecan tarts! So, the bakery rocks!

We have been coming to Big View Diner for about 5 years now, and today was by far our best experience.  The hostesses were very friendly when we arrived, and while one set up our table, the other talked to my 5 year old daughter and treated her as though she was her best friend.  Our waitress was great, and very helpful when it came to dealing with my daughter's dairy allergy.  She took the time to inquire about which foods she could eat, and we didn't even have to ask her to do it.  The kitchen staff was very accommodating to the dairy allergy as well as the gluten allergy for someone else in our party.  The food was delicious, and all of us cleaned our plates.  We will definitely be visiting again!

My family and I have been eating at Big View since it opened and have always enjoyed the food.  We just ate there this evening and were disappointed with our meals.  My son ordered the steak burger and only finished half of it because he said it was flavorless.  I tried it and agreed it definitely could use some seasoning.  My daughter ordered the sliders and the top bun was harder than it should be...under the heat lamps too long?  Stale?  I ordered the spinach pie and while it was just ok that is just a taste preference.  The issue I had was they put the cold salad on a hot plate which in turn wilted the lettuce.  Another thing I noticed is that most diners had a basket of bread which we were not offered. Wondering if it depends on what you order or just the whim of the server as to whether you get bread.  There are so many places to eat in the Ballantyne area that a restaurant really needs to be on their A game at all times.  Tonight Big View wasn't even close.  I probably will give them another chance but it will be a very long time from tonight.

Very nice place. Too nice to have diner in the name. Very classy. The calamari was awesome and the crab cake sandwich was good. Friend had patty melt she said was awesome. The fries were awesome shoestring type. The classy atmosphere had a classy price but I would definitely go again when in the area.

I know, I know, my last review says I won't be back.  This time I mean it.  I was persuaded by a friend and succumbed to the pressure.  I'll get this out of the way, the service was fine.  Nothing to complain about.  Even though we complained about 2 of the meals we had they handled it with professionalism.  I had the turkey burger, which sounds great on the menu.  It was bland, flavorless and had way too much bread.  In the industry they call this "bun coverage" and this freaking burger didn't come close to covering the footprint of the bun.  The people they have cooking in the back obviously don't know how to check a burger for doneness since there was a big hunk taken out of the burger where they hacked it with their spatula.  My buddy ordered the steak wrap (whatever it's called on the menu) and it was served "burrito style" (note there's a difference between a burrito and a wrap) with so much rice in it and virtually no steak.  For like $11.00 he complained and they fixed it.  My sweet, innocent baby girl who only eats pizza and French fries shared my way too salty French fries that were served with my burger and had to order a flatbread off the menu for $9.00 which had a big hair in it when it was served.  Since we complained about the "wrap" the Manager came over and said "Yeah, the waitress said there was a problem and asked me to come over?"  We told him the deal on the pizza and he asked "did you send it back?" and when we responded he just walked away.  That's it, no apology or anything.  So, we ordered a cheese flatbread with nothing else for a kid were charged full price and got an extra hair in our serving?  The people that own this place are "professionals" right?  What the heck?  Train your Managers how to handle issues when they come up.  Plus the outside dining area was unkempt and very dirty.  French fries and food debris were all over the place.   Flavorless, overpriced, but PACKED.  I think people want this type of restaurant, but Big View IMO doesn't execute well at all.

Came in last night just for dessert.  I gave 2 stars because the place was clean and the staff was very friendly and the service was good.  The desserts were not so good.  I had a slice of strawberry shortcake and I could hardly get past the second bite.  The cream was hard (not refrigerator hard) and it did not taste fresh. The cake portion was also hard.  It tasted stale. My husband had the cheesecake which also tasted stale.  We were up all night because of these desserts.

After initially being excited when I heard this place was going to open a few years ago, I decided against even trying it after all of the very mixed reviews. Eventually, I forgot about the diner and went about my business. It's not exactly right next door for me, so that was easy to do. This past weekend a friend wanted to do lunch and I wanted some pecan pie. I suggested The Landmark Diner, which I enjoy a few times a month. She said it was too far. The Big View Diner popped into my head and we were off.  I liked the decor, with all the stations labeled and everything looking like a modern day version of fifties eatery. The lighting is interesting as well as the wall color and the booth seating. I was that jerk snapping photos with his cell phone the other day ... sorry.  She had been there a few times prior and had not the best food experiences, but she didn't bother to tell me. But, she's finicky, I said to myself. I wasn't sure what I wanted, so the server suggested several things over the large menu from burgers to salads to the $20 ribs. (Sorry, but I go to Texas Roadhouse for my $20 steak and ribs, and that is a different review that I have already written)  I eventually settled on the steak and eggs with home fries for thirteen dollars. Not bad. She got a gyro with specific instructions on how she wanted it. Like I said, finicky. The food arrived in a decent amount of time and was tasty. Nothing fancy, but it was hot and there was plenty of it. The steak was much larger than expected and I could have -- nay, should have -- taken half of it home. And I am not a huge fan of lots of spices in my food usually, so I was pretty happy with what I got.   My lunch mate got hers with seasoning on her fries, against what she had requested. They were very nice about it and she was able to exchange for some home fries and didn't charge her for the mistake. Otherwise, she was happy with her meal. We also got two deserts, the pecan pie and silk chocolate pie. Both were tasty. The server suggested a scoop of ice cream with my warm pecan pie, I think now I should have taken him up on it but I was so full at the time I didn't think it would fit in my belly.  I left there with a satisfied and full stomach with the open possibility of returning.

This is one of my go to spots! On those nights you just don't feel like it.... this is a reliable staple. Whether you are hungry for breakfast all day or you need comfort food.... this place has got it all!  I am one of those people that if I'm going to eat out or unhealthy it has to seriously be worth it! That being said.... the pancakes are not just pancakes..... they are fluffy, crispy deliciousness! The French toast has this amazing flavor with the perfect amount of batter. Again, soft in the middle but crispy on the outside. My last breakfast fave is the salmon bagel. Always fresh & light! Can you tell I like breakfast?!  My absolute favorite meal is beef stroganoff though. I get it with a French onion soup to start. It's so much food that me & my hubby started splitting it!   Then of course there is dessert! What can I say about their dessert?! There really are no words! We will come out after having dinner at home just have dessert & coffee.  The service is always spot on. Oh & if you love bloody marys..... this is the best I've found in Ballantyne! Just sayn!  Love, love, love this place!

Good food, especially for a diner. I enjoyed the ilois spinach dish which comes with a very good Greek salad. My guest had the chicken & waffles which was served with warm syrup. The best thing about this place is how clean it was when I entered!

It took 45 minutes to get an appetizer for the table, over an hour for two side salads to arrive, and still after 75 minutes no dinner.  The positive would be that the salads and egg rolls were tasty. We enjoyed them while we watched 4 tables seated after us enjoy their food.  Seems like poor service is a common theme with this place.  Major disappointment, really was looking for a local spot to enjoy.

My niece and I visited on a Sunday morning. The place was packed so we thought it had to be good. We were seated in a party room with two other large parties. We were the only two besides the parties. There were no condiments on the table. The scrambled eggs were under cooked and runny. The sliced tomatoes were old and not good. The chicken sausage was not tasty at all. On the flip side, the coffee, rye toast and real butter were great. It was expensive for breakfast. $25 for the two of us. I will not return.

Service started our good, place is clean and well laid out.  The food was excellent and made better by the before 11 specials.  2nd time here and would visit every day for breakfast.    Love the the grits, next time biscuit instead of toast.  Sausage was great.  Very good coffee.

I am seriously pleased to see all of the 1 star reviews and the same statements I would have made (really excited when it was being built, looked forward to it opening, related to Nolen and Ilios Noche so it HAD to be good, yadda yadda).  We went ONCE.  That's all it deserved.  Let me share our disappointment:  1. Frozen vegetables... why? 2. Instant mashed potatoes?  I mean WTF?  You can't actually cut up and boil potatoes in a diner? 3. Chicken piccata with no capers. Ummm, what do you mean the kitchen ran out? THERE'S A ****ING HARRIS TEETER IN THE PARKING LOT, SEND A BUS BOY TO BUY A JAR. 4. Not exactly cheap, either.  The desserts looked good.  We took home a piece of something... it was OK.  If you have the late night munchies for sweets, stop in and get a slice of cake... otherwise, dine at Ilios Noche or Nolen.  UPDATE: My wife had to do a business dinner there recently and said "it didn't suck".  Possibly Big View has figured it out and has decided to stop skimping on ingredients.  It's still WAY overpriced for what you get, though.  Review remains at 1 star until I taste improvements myself.

Well, I haven't been here in quite awhile so decided try it again tonight.  I had the Stroganoff, very disappointing. Reminded me of hamburger helper. Very bland.  My girlfriend had the Seafood Fra Diabolo, I thought it was extremely spicy and took away from the seafood taste.  The Red Velvet cake was regular chocolate cake with regular creme topping, not the usual cream cheese mixture.  Portions were very good. Service was very good.  Will not go back

Had dinner there the other night for the first time. Their sesame salmon sandwich was to die for. Easily the best salmon sandwich I've ever had. Atmosphere is great as well. Staff is very friendly. No real complaints at all.

I've been here twice. The first time was really good.  The chicken and dumplings were great and normally thats something I'd never order out.   We also had the open face roast beef which was also good.    The second time we went my mom had the lemon roasted chicken which she said was dry and tasteless.  I had the fish and chips. The fish was good but would have appreciated it if they had warned that there were bones.  I got one stuck in my gum.  I also had the eclair. I couldnt wait to sink my teeth down into it.  Well, it was the most tasteless eclair I've ever had.  I threw it away.    I'm guessing my two visits were it.

Huge menu with so many choices that it takes 30 minutes to figure out what you want.  First time here, I ordered a salad for lunch. The salad with chicken. Salad was good but chicken was too salty.  Second time here, I ordered fish for dinner. Fish was really good.  I think you would come here for variety.

This place is hard to miss if you ever go down Johnston Rd... can't remember if it turns into Lancaster before you hit the restaurant or not - but it's at the corner of Audrey Kell.  First impressions from the street make it look to be an upscale diner, and when I walked in I had the aroma of breakfast hit me in the face.  I love breakfast - but it was dinner... actually it was time for a drink (after a rough day).  The wait staff greeted us nicely and we asked to sit at the bar.  The bartender was over the top (in a good way).  Very nice young woman with tons of energy named Marci.    She took our drink orders - and we also decided to eat so I tried the open faced tuna melt.  It was a lot of tuna, but good... fries were good.  My friend had a ruben and that thing never stood a chance.  I'm guess it was good as well.  I'd say I'm a fan for now... but I rarely get to go to this side of town so I will try to make it a point to give this place a couple more visits and update my review.

I've been here twice for lunch. Both experiences were quite opposite. Both experiences I ordered breakfast. The first time I ordered their jallah friend toast and the 2nd I ordered the breakfast platter (can't remember what name they called it).  Service wise, the first time it was just average. The server the second time was really good and friendly but messed up part of my order. The food is slow making it from kitchen to table.  Foodwise, the jallah friend toast is excellent. Their bacon is good. For the platter, the pancakes had an odd baking soda taste to them. The home fries could have been fried a little more. They were a bit mushy. The eggs were good but it's hard to screw up a fried egg. I did receive grits with mine even though i ordered home fries. They were flavorless and unappealing.   So judging by my 2 visits here, I'd say this place is hit or miss. Could be great one time and average the next. But isn't that what we love about diners?

Good price, good family atmosphere. But most loved for their desserts! All fresh and made in house. Get the TRIPLE D if it's your birthday, most elaborate ice cream plate I've ever seen. Plus the owners are Greek so I advice trying their Greek plates, you'll be surprisingly impressed

I'm giving this place 5 stars because they did a AMAZING job on my 30th b-day cake. My sister ordered the lemon raspberry cake in the shape of a 3 & 0! OMG it was the most amazing looking and tasting cake. All my friends were wowed by it and it was so MASSIVE I took the 0 to work and by the end of the day it was gone it rave reviews. I'm can't comment on the food but the desserts (and drinks) are to die for.  This place did my cake justice that no other bake/cake shop could do and I recommend your next dessert extravagance be the Big View Diner!!!!!!

If you're in the Ballantyne area and are looking for a family-friendly joint with great breakfast or homemade desserts, this is your place. Their omelets are delicious. I'm not sure what they put into their grits, but it works! It's also one of the best dessert places in the area. The peanut butter brownie cheesecake is awesome.  I think someone who works there is an iCarly fan because they put spaghetti tacos on the kid's menu. That satisfies the little ones. :D

Tried the roasted turkey Cobb salad, the ranchero bowl, and a crispy Carolina flounder sandwich. The turkey in the salad was a little dry but the rest of it was good. Nice crispy bacon for texture. The crispy Carolina flounder sandwich was huge and cooked really well. Juicy and very crispy. The ranchero bowl was presented well and had nice crispy chips, however would have been easier to eat if they weren't so long. The rice in the bowl had a subtle lime taste which wasn't too strong. Fresh avocado with seasoned chicken. Overall, the price was good for the amount of food. Also the food was tasty.  The setting was a little deceiving, originally I thought it would be a casual diner. The inside and presentation is a bit more classy than a classic diner. A bit thrown off and a bit under dressed. The service could improve. Not as attentive and rarely checked in with us to make sure we were doing fine or if we needed refills. The place wasn't packed either

I really wanted to like this place. It's close to home. So close. And I L-O-V-E Ilios Noches (same owners). If I could, I would have given it 2.5 stars. I have had a couple of business lunches there and they were good. I had the spinach pie/salad combo. Their spinach pie is excellent - maybe the best I have ever had. Though it always tastes a little better at Ilios Noches.   Last night, we gave it a shot for dinner. Disappointed. The descriptions of what I ordered (bbq burger on brioche) sounded great. The execution: not so great. The brioche bun was stale, the burger tasteless, the fries cold. Service was slooow. We requested more ketchup 4 times before finally receiving. Then they tried to rush us out, so they could seat another party.   Like I said, disappointing.

I really enjoyed the food here.  We actually went twice, two days in a row.  HOWEVER we noticed the servers did not know the menu at all, I mean after 3 months employed you should start to be familiar with the menu.    It's a little pricey, BUT if you come Monday thru Friday at lunch, they actually have a $7.99 menu, which again, the servers couldn't figure out whether that included a drink or not, an extra vegetable with the entree or not.  It changed depending on who you asked and what day.  "THAT"S GOOD MON. THRU FRIDAY."  Then on Monday, that's not the menu for today etc... constant runaround.    They have like three different menus and specials depending on when you go.  We ordered and then they came back and said that wasn't the menu for Sunday lunch and did we want to change our order?  Um, no.  The same items were on the Sunday menu, so I don't know why we would need to change the items.  So we paid several dollars more for the "Sunday Menu" portions (i.e. the SAME thing, right??)  The servers got to be a running joke with our group.  Every server answered questions, "I THINK..."   "I"m NOT SURE..."  "I BELIEVE..."  IT SEEMS LIKE IT WOULD go with that..."   It's like doesn't anyone actually KNOW what comes with what.  The three menus are confusing, when does one get which one on what day? etc...  especially since the menu items are the SAME.  Definitely a lack of knowledge on the servers' parts.   The management needs to step up.     The food was wonderful!  Great entrees and desserts.  I would still return just for the food.  So I don't get the bad reviews on the food.

My husband and I really like this place for lunch. Breakfast is served all day and there is a huge selection (bonus for him) and everything is made in-house with fresh breads and farmers market veggies etc. (bonus for me).   The service is always very friendly and even what it's slammed we are usually able to get in and out fairly quickly.   Three quick tips...  Save dieting for another day because they have the best ranch ever.   Do not bother with their mixed-greens salad side option ...it's just plain lettuce with dressing (not even a mixture of lettuces') .   Also bring a sweater because they BLAST the AC.

Food here is tasty and well done. Cleanliness is another story. Went for breakfast with my 12 year old daughter and we sat at the bar. Food on the placemats. Food all over the footrest-bar. It was old food - as if they'd cleaned, but didn't do it well enough...multiple times.   I've always liked the food. Service is fine. Let's hope the mgt improves the cleanliness.
Excellent dinner!  Best spinach pie ever!!   The Service was attentive and warm.  A truly delightful lunch experience!

The burger I got was not good, it had absolutely no taste and the patty looked like it came right out of shrink wrap and was just heated under a light. The fries were mushy cold and undercooked. Had to send it back and go somewhere else. It's a shame because the place looks pretty good. But I won't be back.
Overwhelming menu, but good food. Nothing to rave about, but always pretty satisfied. Their dessert selection is extensive too!
Very humid inside. Chicken noodle soup was not hot. Chicken pot pie veggies weren't cooked enough. It's a large waffle house at best.

The Big View Diner is a ways out if you're coming from Charlotte, but for those on the south side, it could be relatively convenient. What I'm really not sure about is the view - there really isn't much view there, except of the inside. The place is huge. I mean gigantic. Yet it's still packed to the gills so much that you may have to wait at certain times. Luckily you have the option to take a look at their amazing desserts just waiting for you while you hang out waiting for a table. Luckily, the wait for the table isn't generally too long because they have so much space. That's the good news.  The bad news is that service, while friendly, really isn't that good. I don't know if they are understaffed (doesn't look like it) or just have issues, but whatever the case, it takes a really long time between being seated, being greeted, being served, getting your glasses filled/refilled, getting a check, getting the receipt after paying, etc. I mean it takes a long time.  As to the food? It's reasonable. There are plenty of options, both here in this same parking lot and all around the Charlotte metro, so it's probably not somewhere we will venture to often, but it's worth checking out if this is your thing. And it's not really a diner, so keep that in mind. Also, I will give them props for mentioning, even in the chaos of a huge room, and lack of service at the table, those at the host stand actually told us to have a nice day as we left. By name. That was a nice touch.

This restaurant is huge! I've always wanted to try this place because it's so noticeable from the road. We came here for brunch one day. Hostesses at the front were not the friendliest. I have a 4 letter last name that's pretty common. She asked me what my last name was and I told her. She asked me to spell it for her and I did. She asked me again to spell it for her and I did again. My husband walked up next to me and asked again what the last name was. My husband told her and spelled it out for her again. He then chuckled and told me he saw it spelled wrong.   We got sat at a booth. Server came and got our drink order. One of my friends got a large orange juice.
