When the server came to the table, she had two glasses of orange juice. He asked her if the two glasses was one order of orange juice and she looked confused and said "no?". He told her he only wanted one glass of oj. She still looked confused and took it back. We all gave her our orders. I asked for a side of salsa and and asked me if I wanted turkey or regular. I looked at her confused? I told her I just wanted a side of salsa. She understood what I said and said ok.   The food was good. Big portions. I did get the western omelette. It was good BUT there was hardly any ham in it!   The service from walking in to leaving is just ok! Not sure if I will be back again. Maybe one day though.

This diner is the best dinner, lunch, and breakfast spot for great affordable food. Every dish is well made and fresh. These are the same owners of ilios noche where the food is amazing as well. The best way to describe this place is a diner with restaurant style food. The jambalaya is the best! Highly recommend if you have a big party to keep costs down and still get a great meal.

If you don't want the details, it was great.  If you do want the details... The wait at dinner time was not as bad as we would have expected for a seat. There were 4 families in front of us and we sat in the 15 min they quoted. Our server was very fun and helpful. We split the caprese chicken sandwich as we wanted to leave room for the "triple d" desert. The sandwich had to be one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. The quality of chicken was great, but I guess I had never had that combination of chicken, tomatoes, mozzarella, basil and balsamic (I know one of you are yelling at me for never having this). The wait between getting refills, ordering and receiving the check might not have been as quick as some other restaurants we have been, but to be expected out of a traditional diner, I didn't mind. The atmosphere is definitely upscale for a diner, but similar traditional menu items plus some new favorites. The only thing I found strange is the sports bar in the front room....that's not very diner-like and they had sports memorabilia on the walls from what seems like any team that has nothing to do with Charlotte.

Decent Diner/Lounge place - interesting decor and exceptional service.  I came here for a work team lunch meeting and the food was surprisingly good.  Lunch portions were big, even the chocolate chip cookie I ordered to go was as big as my face. Will prob return with the fam to check it out for dinner.

Hubs and I checked this place out for a casual lunch during the work week. It's pretty impressive from the outside - a massivo diner that looks like a '60s diner on steroids.   Inside, it's nicely laid out with a large cocktail bar up front and a long sit 'n eat bar on the side. We had to wait a few minutes for a table on a Tuesday afternoon (which was a bit odd) but were pleasantly greeted and seated in no time. As for the menu - it's pretty extensive. There are quite a few options that will likely satisfy a variety of palettes. I went with the grilled chicken and veggie sandwich and hubs chose the Reuben.   Overall, the food was good but nothing spectacular. My sammie was pretty tasty - the veggies were grilled, albeit a bit soggy, and the chicken was tender. I tried a few of hubs' fries and they were pretty good - thicker cut fries with the right amount of salt. I just wish they were crispier.   It's a decent spot to stop for a lunch...I'll give it another go with a different menu item. I also really want to try their shakes and desserts!

Been here a multiple times in the past 6 months and the food is good but the service is horrible, I always sit at the bar since I'm alone and have never gotten good service.  I always have to ask for a refill after my glass is empty for 5 minutes.  I have heard the bartenders complain multiple times about their tips and I honestly think that is so rude in front of a customer.  I have never walked in and been greeted either by the bartender they will continue their convo and then finally acknowledge me.  Good to get to go food but def not the worth the service

I'm a big fan of big view and I have been coming here for a while now, but lately the quality of service has declined tremendously. Specifically, the bar service.  We all know bartenders have a stressful job and it can get over whelming,  but it should never be shown to your customers. A bad attitude is a sure deterrent. Also, not only did we have to wait 30 mins which is really ok for a table but we waited another 30 to place the order once we were sat. Maybe the view is short on staff today. But Ya disappointing. We may not come back for a while.  GET IT TOGETHER!!

Big View Diner is a great place for brunch. I have only been to the restaurant for brunch, but after going a couple of times, it's towards the top of my list. I tend to get a western egg white omelette but it has so much flavor that I forget it's all egg whites. The English muffins are great and the side of fruit is fresh and delicious. I have also had the challah french toast which is amazing! It's so light and fluffy, and with a side of bacon, it's perfect.  I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. It's partially reminiscent of diners up north but with a more modern feel. It is also so difficult to resist all the wonderful baked goods on the way out - they all look so good! I always keep my eye out for rainbow cookies - they're my favorite!

Had absolutely wonderful service tonight! Walked in with a party of 9 and our server, Amanda, was beyond accommodating and so delightful!  We had two toddlers with us and our server made sure their food came out with our starters so they would stay happy!  Amanda really went above and beyond explaining menu items and making sure we were taken care of!   Ate the balsamic salmon and it was INCREDIBLE and cooked perfectly!   The host were another story as when we walked in one rolled her eyes when we said we had no reservation but our service more than made up for this bad taste at first.

Not great service and it's my second time here. Food is OK but if you sit in the middle of the dinning be prepared to be blasted with Italian music. I couldn't even hear the server ask certain questions.   Not a place I would recommend.
Excellent dessert case.  One of the few places I have found with chicken and waffles that has boneless chicken.

Ehhh....it's alright....  The restaurant is a lot larger than I anticipated so we were seated quickly. The server was prompt in taking our order. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The server asked if I wanted the salad that came with it. I answered yes and she raced off, while I sat wondering what dressing she would bring since she didn't ask. Well....it comes tossed in a balsamic dressing. The salad was soggy as if they just make up a big bowl of it and let it sit all day. So two bites of that was enough. The chicken and waffles were okay, I wouldn't go there specifically for that but it wasn't bad. The waffle was actually pretty good it tasted fresh. The chicken was two thin chicken breasts with a very coarse texture. Not really sure how else to describe it. Getting out was a challenge. I had to ask for my check even after my plate had been taken. Then I had to figure out if I paid the server or up front. I decided to pay up front because it seemed like the server was never coming back. We did get a slice of key lime raspberry cake....I didn't chose it. Anyways, it was not good. The icing, the cake, no part of it was good. It was pretty though.....
I highly recommend going here for lunch. I get the salmon and not only is it fantastic, but it's only $8 or so. Perfect spot for a meeting or nice meal.

Great place! I went for dinner and ordered fettuccine alfredo with broccoli. The Caesar salad that accompanied my dish was huge and delicious! I was surprised by how big it was. Also, in my Oprah voice, I LOVE BREAD and the bread basket was amaze-balls! It was warm and croissant-like. The other dishes ordered looked good too. I tasted a bit of my husband's chicken and waffles dish and it was really good. I also thought their chicken diavolo dish looked amazing. I'll probably order it next time. Unfortunately, we were all so full we didn't order dessert. But the desserts all looked to die for.  The service was great too. Will definitely return

We've become regulars - good spot for breakfast, lunch or dinner - waitstaff is friendly and good is always fresh and hooray, CONSISTENT - I tend to get the same omelette for breakfast and it's always as I want it... They make awesome bread, pastries and desserts and the Greek influence is reflective in their appetizers/meal offerings. Fresh greek (yes, real greek) yogurt and fresh feta.... YUM!!! Love Big View and hope to be a regular for many more years.

I had Sunday Brunch at The Big View Diner. I arrived at 1100 and the wait to be seated was about 30 minutes.  Once seated the wait to be served was almost as long. The food was very good and within the price range for a "diner" breakfast. No complaints and I ll go back the next time I'm in the area.
You just cannot beat Big View Diner for the food,service,atmosphere and the desserts...oh yes the fantastic desserts.

We never leave disappointed! I ordered the smoked salmon, Swiss, tomato, and onion grilled cheese with home fries and my husband ordered the chicken and waffles with a side of scrambled eggs with cheese. My sandwich was tasty but different from my beloved smoked salmon bagel. I'm not a huge fan of sandwiches on toasted bread because I don't like how it scratches my gums (I know it's weird, don't judge me) but the sandwich tasted good! I didn't know the home fries would have peppers in them. I'm not a fan of peppers but they were still quite tasty. Now let me tell you about my husband's dish. Yummy in my tummy!! The chicken tenders tasted like it was fried similarly to Chinese fried chicken. SOOO TASTY!! The next time we go, I will be ordering this!!! The service is good also!

The food was great. We started off with appetizer quesadilla. Nice and I  had the pasta with creamy tomatoe vodka sauce plus shrimps. My son had a burger with fries. Was a great meal but looking forward to breakfast.
The food looks great, but it didn't taste fresh, my daughter's first time tasting chicken and waffles and the chicken had to be cooked in old oil.

Okay-so I am a Queens (NY) boy and grew up going to diners as a big part of my life. I have found it impossible to find a "real" diner outside of the New York area. Well-I found it!   Came here while visiting family down south. We were a group of 9 and everyone enjoyed. The atmosphere is fun and energetic. It is very open and appetizing. Billy was our waiter and did a wonderful job with nine people to serve including 2 children. He was patient and kind.   They have a "normal" diner menu. Basically it has anything you could ever want on it. The food was good - very good. I can vouch for the broiled Mahi Mahi, skirt streak salad, calamari and chicken pretzel (don't ask). Everyone at the table enjoyed their meals including burgers, fish, etc.   It is not overpriced and our meals were presented nicely.   They seem to specialize in desserts and our table had everything from chocolate silk pie (mini pie) to a chocolate & cherry milkshake. It was all good.  They are located in the south so yes-they do have sweet tea and grits if you want but don't waste the trip here-order real diner food! Although, my wife loves sweet tea and they have unlimited refills so she was happy (happy wife, happy home if you know what I mean).

unfortunately last night's visit was terrible. my "stuffed flounder" contained a scant, 3 finger width of actual flounder, propped up to appear like more by mostly cups of rice.  then, a group of 12 came in just after we started eating....and we never saw our waiter ever again. We waited 20 minutes during which we asked 2 other waiters to rescue us.  When our check was presented, it incorrectly included desert which we never received.  To add insult to injury, it took another 15 minutes to remove the desert cost.... which they were unable to do correctly.
Best selection, best quality, best prices...Frank and Angelo make you feel at home. You can go in your sweats if you want! Best in Ballantyne!
Excellent food and service. The banana pudding is great!  My main entree was the steak burger which was excellent as well.  We had to wait about 25 minutes for our seat, but it was worth it!

Just had a great dinner at Big View.  This was our second visit, first time was just for a burger which was nothing special.  Tonight was really good.  They told us there would be a 20 minute wait, but it was only 10.  Love the fact that they started off under promising and over delivering.  We were promptly met by our waiter, Russ, although the place was packed and he had several tables.    The menu is intense as well as enticing!  Russ allowed us to take our time checking in without being hurried or impatient.  I ordered the chicken fettuccine had a house salad with the house vinaigrette.  My husband had the chicken Marsala.  We received fresh challah bread and butter and soon after our salads.  Once we finished our salad (vinaigrette was a bit tart) our meal came.  My fettuccine was really creamy and fresh with a great flavor to the chicken breast that was served sliced on top.  The chicken Marsala came over a bed of mashed potatoes with mushrooms, roasted tomatoes and asparagus.  It was a very nice presentation.  We will be coming back!  We also brought some eclairs home for later, cant wait.  The dessert menu is extensive and I cant wait to try it all!!  Downside:  There was a party with a few children who were allowed to run the restaurant, almost running into servers several times.  No one said anything and it was quite distracting.  Kind of gave the evening a McDonald's playground feel.

As soon as I walked in the servers were super friendly! Apparently my laugh is quite infectious and they were all happy to see me. Sweet! Now...let's get to the food!   I tried the chicken and waffles, and while not the best I've ever had, it was yummy! The waffle was delicioso! It was light and crispy, just how I like it! And guess what! They had bacon maple syrup! Mmmmmm!  The chicken was ok...it was pretty much a chicken tender set on top of the waffle. While well seasoned, I've had better. They were massive though, and made for a perfect midnight snack later after a night out.  All in all, I enjoyed my experience here and will return to try some of the other yummy sounding offerings on their menu!

We had a quick group work lunch at Big View Diner, and it was the first for all five of us. The restaurant, belying its name, is a big, spacious, airy diner, with a nice buildout and great relaxed feel (nothing loud or harried about it, although it was fairly empty at lunchtime).   The restaurant is very clean, it has a nice bar area and big encased dessert display. Service was very friendly. We split two apps of falafel, which came out like twohuge crab cakes, surrounded by pepper sauce, taziki, salad and pillowy wedges of warm pita bread (very tasty). We all enjoyed the falafel.  The menu is quite diverse and a little perplexing, ranging from Greek and Middle Eastern, salads, sandwiches, pastas, to traditional American breakfasts and southern favorites like chicken 'n waffles and pork chops with stuffing. The "pick two" selections looked hearty and generous (whole toasted sandwiches or salads served with big bowls of soup). I opted for a chicken souvlaki wrap - it was big, tasty and fresh; the chicken was tender and juicy if rather underseasoned.  Very good place to stop for lunch, at reasonable prices.

Breakfast this morning. Wait wasn't terrible but the service was. I hate to write bad reviews but this was just so unexpected based on what we had read. We got sat in the bar area at a super small table. Waiter was extremely slow and not engaging at all. Food was meh. Wouldn't suggest it.

We eat breakfast and sometimes lunch here often. The quality of the food is ready good and the service is quick. Well usually get Omelets or sometimes I get the spinach Greek thing (forgot what it's called).

Since my job moved into this area recently this place is really close, and I had been wanting to try it for Lunch.  I had always heard great things.  Big View Diner is a good size place and the Decor is also really nice for what you would normally see in a Diner.  One you first walk in you smell the freshly baked goods they have at the counter which includes Cookies, Cakes and other many goodies.  I almost wanted to just get dessert and then leave....lol.  The menu offered a good variety.  I ended up getting the Chicken Salad sandwich on Whole Wheat Toast with a Pasta Salad as the side.  I have to say it was a little piece of Heaven.  Very yummy.  The waitress we had was also very good and attentive.  I definitely recommend this place, and will be going back soon for Lunch.

My favorite place for breakfast.  They have done great with hiring wait staff, food quality is consistent, and the atmosphere is wonderful.  Great weekday deals on breakfast, and other meal entrees are tasty.
Food was terrible.  Hamburger was very greasy low quality. French onion soup was as piece of bread soaked in salty beef bullion very over cooked fake cheese.  I would recommend this restaurant

The ambiance is fun and the servers are attentive. I have it 3 stars only because there omlette, albeit good, wasn't anything I couldn't get anywhere else and the toast was barely warm... The butter didn't (couldn't) melt. I think this might be due to the fact that it appears the toast is made in batches and placed on one's plate as that order comes up. So I guess if your order occurs when the batch first comes out, you'll be a lucky one who gets to have toast with nice melty butter. Clearly I like melted butter on my toast.  My husband, however, had the chicken and waffles and loved every bite of it.
pretty good food . fresh breads with dinner . fresh veggies. great soup.

Been here many times.  I really do actually enjoy the place but can't quite give it 5 stars.  I would say that it more about location (close to my home) than food only because I find it to be a little expensive.  $10-$12 for an omelete is a little steep for this guy.    Other than that, I ventured away from the omeletes and got one of the eggs benedict choices.  Eggs Benedict Crabcake style!  That was a perfect mixture of crunchy crabcake, muffin and hollandaise sauce.  Great call there!  Overall, you will enjoy.  Just avoid the crazy busy times like Sunday brunch after church goers start rolling through.  Yikes!  -Ian M.
Never had a bad meal here!  Huge portions & terrific value!  My favorite things are the Spanish Omelette (breakfast served all day!) & the Chicken Marsala.  Service is great.
The food has always been spot on. The Spinach Pie is actually the best I've ever had! Outstanding food at a fair price--check it out.

We were really looking forward to dinner at Big View tonight because we had been several times and the food is really good. Unfortunately the service ruined the entire experience.  Our friend called in for call ahead seating and when we arrived we were told 20-25 minutes.  Ended up waiting 1 hour for our table. Absolute waste of time! The service continued to be slow because we were seated in the bar (with 4 kids under 12) and the bartender was our server. Our dinner took over 3 hours..totally unacceptable with 4 kids. Food is good but not worth the time.
Awesome, quick lunch experience! Had the carrot cake pancakes with cream cheese and they were delicious!! Can't wait to come back and try other dishes on the menu!

Back again - 3rd time this week.  Simply can't get enough -- so much to choose from but my go to right now is the soup and grilled   **updated March 24, 2018 Well - all good things come to and today was it. We raved about Big View and took our out of town guests. Seems anytime you brag about a place, the next trip is terrible. Got here at 2:30 and it wasn't busy. No wait, except for service. Our waiter had to be new. Ordered food, wife's salad comes out wrong - no problem as he took that back. 15 minutes later, a new salad, that went with her soup, appeared. He sat it down and left not staying long enough to find out our friend's onion rings were burnt, yet somehow cold. We flagged another server and said there is an issue with her rings. He didn't ask, just to the plate. The problem was she was holding her sandwich - now, no where to put her sandwich down. And oh yeah, no silverware for the table yet either. 20 minutes pass by and our normal server came by - which we say we're all out of drinks and her rings never came back. He leaves and returns quickly with the rings. Guess they were sitting in the window for awhile.  After 1.5 hours of ordering and eating lunch, the waiter returns to check on us. We decide to order a piece of cannoli cake - wife is crazy about them.  Well, guess he didn't hear as he brought us the check about 10 minutes later - all on 1 check versus asking about splitting between the 2 couples or even asking where the dessert went - since we never got.   Well, this was the first bad experience here - and it was brutal. I'm sure we will go back at some point - but will be taking a break.

Big View offers so much variety it's a great place when you have diverse tastes amongst your group or family to appease!  Something for everyone & all delish! Excellent value, we often get two meals out of our entrees. Dinner & lunch for tomorrow?  Hey, I'm down with that!  The beef brisket stroganoff is wow...SO good & the shrimp & grits- fabulous & unique from other versions I've tasted.   Also, we met with Tina in the Big View's Bakery regarding our wedding cake. She was super helpful & kind and made the process pleasant and simple!

If Jay Gatsby and a hipster teamed up to renovate IHOP, it would look like this.  The food is traditional but there is some effort made to make it elegant and unique.  The bathroom door squeaks, the Charlotte Observer box is broken, and the booths are a little small.  But by comparison to the closet sized IHOP or the older breakfast haunts, this is still a brilliant place.
Excellent service and the Asian pork was amazing!!! It was on special but they are putting it in the menu!! Reminds me of NYC!

I've been here a few times and I have never been let down. Service has always been great and the food has always been great as well. For breakfast The Belgian waffles, the chicken and waffles, and most of their omlettes are really good. For lunch the veal meatloaf is absolutely amazing as well as the jambalaya and a few other things. For sides the whipped potatoes are a must they are awesome, their sweet potatoe fries are also really good. If you're in the area and don't know what to eat try this place out. They also make pastries and cakes however I haven't tried any of them yet, they look really good though haha.

3.5  I was here for breakfast/brunch a few days ago.  Its pretty hard to botch eggs and bacon so I can't speak to their culinary skills but everything was pretty good.  I kept waiting for that defining moment...for something to happen that would boost this place from good to amazing but it never quite happened.  I was looking for a basket of biscuits to be served with the meal or for a special jam to spread over my toast but I was left with the basics and a hefty ballantyne pricetag to boot!    I was in the middle of my Christmas cookie eating marathon so I didn't try anything from the bakery but it all looked incredible!  I agree there is a shortage of diners here in charlotte and this place certainly gets an "A" for effort but lacks the feel of a true, authentic diner.  For one thing, the menu is not very extensive (real diners have 3 huge pages of breakfast items), they r pretty overpriced (regular diners will offer a huge breakfast for less than $10 but not so much here), there was not any fun memorabilia on the walls or anything "50's" about it...which you have to pay homage to..that's when diners existed!  Sooo..ok, I get it...this is a more upscale diner...it has many positive points and certainly serves up a good standard breakfast.  Nothing crazy, nothing special, just predictable.  I wouldn't run out of my way to go back but I am not opposed to returning if in the area.  I am curious about their bakery.  All of the baked goods looked amazing but I have consistently heard that it is not good at all.  I'm going to need to investigate that a bit further.    Consensus?  Take it or leave it

This updated review and rating hurts me to do...  My Mom lives in the area and this is her breakfast of choice on Sunday mornings.  She is a creature of habit, unfortunately. So, over the last few months although the food is good, I have seen a lack of flavor and presentation to our meals.  And, more importantly, the service has taken a complete turn, for the worst.   Sunday mornings are typically very crowded, but I find us sitting for long periods of time, waiting for the waitress to take our order, waiting for our food, and waiting for our check...Very disappointing.   And, one side note for anyone that has enjoyed their Bloody Mary, they have changed the recipe.  They previously used a pre-made mix, Zing Zang, but have decided to take the plunge and make their own.  And, it was horrible!!! All you could taste was horshradish, I even sent my back and sent the second one back and finally just went with a mimosa. Unfortunately my Mom smelled like horshradish the entire day.  Please go back to Zing Zang!!    I know I will be back so I will keep you posted on any improvements, or not, that I see.
Here again on this very hot day. The coolness of the Diner I believe brings more people in. There is a very big crowd here on Sundays.

This is my third time here. Straight Ridiculous. I discovered it by accident and they have over delivered each time. Excellent food quality, great service, a mix between fine dining and diner menu. Try it and thank me later.

We went on our first date trying to start a romantic and nice conversation while we were eating ,but the waitress did not stop interrupting by asking every 5 minutes  how was what we were eating!! really guys? so anoying!!. I understand that they try to be attentive to the client but there are limits to the respect. Good food, no good for first dates.

For months I've waited for this place to open- the sign on the outside advertised Big View Diner and Sports Lounge.  What a colossal disappointment!  First the highlights- the food really is very good, and I certainly do not want to take away from the diverse menu or good tasting food.  However it really is more of a diner than lounge, let alone sports lounge.  I was there at 8:00PM (they will be open for breakfast) on a Thursday night- they did have all of the TV's on sports channels, however there are only 4 TV's in the bar.  The other detractor from what has the potential to be a cool place was the 8 kids under the age of 10 (I was actually looking for the ball pit or slide) I counted in the bar and the word diner seems to have attracted the over 65 crowd- which is surprising because again it was 8PM.   The service was really slow (bar and wait staff) and they have no concept of how long it takes to turn tables but I will give them the benefit of the doubt since it just opened.  Overall if you are looking for a place to get a good meal on that side of town- this is the place, but if you want a little more fun and excitement don't waste your time.
We've been here a total of probably 8 times so far and the food is good, portions are huge but the waiters are slooooow! I mean every time we're in there we're in no rush which works out but geeze!

Born and raised in Queens, NY, I spent almost every weekend in a diner. There's a certain vibe to New York diners them that is hard to capture here in the south.  Big View nails it, with everything from the dessert case, to the set up, to the diner smell (NYers will get it). The breakfast is great and is all I ever order.  The staff is awesome too!  Ps another great option for NY diners is Landmark Diner on central Ave. Not as good as Big view, but def the ny vibe.

GO HERE FOR BIRTHDAY CAKES! They give you amazing custom cakes for a realllly great price. You will be so happy you did. Just give them a detailed description & a few days advanced notice.   The deviled eggs is where you should start. Who doesn't like bacon topped deviled eggs?   I get the south western salad with blackened chicken. It has never disappointed. My gf gets the jambalaya & we split it. Make sure you ask them to take the tails off of your shrimp ( nothing more annoying than picking them off or accidentally biting one) also ask for extra sauce.  Cody the manager is always on point.

This was first time at Big View and I will definitely be back. When we first were sat the hostess sat us at a small table by the bar which I wasn't too happy about. I asked our waitress if she can move us but only if we were able to keep her as a waitress. She was able to move us to a booth and she was still able to be our waitress. We order the hand cut zucchini for apps and they were really good. I ordered the chicken and waffles dinner and my husband ordered the Thanksgiving plate. Both meals were really good.
Love this place for breakfast. Great option on menu for all meals and good vibe inside.  Awesome desserts!

First time here and will never be back. The hostess was enough to make me not want to stay. Apparently there's not enough menus to seat people on a busy Sunday. And she will "get fired" for seating people without menus. I was told this after watching a table of 10 get sat without menus. People were getting sat coming in after me claiming to have reservations. The hostess made it seem that if I had called to ask for a table I wouldn't be waiting as long, but because I was already at the restaurant I would be further down the list. The hostess was frantic and very rude. Will NEVER be back. I guess if you plan on going to this piss poor establishment you may want to call them before walking inside to avoid waiting.
Their breakfast is the best although you really can't go wrong eating there anytime of the day such a big variety.

Me and the rest of my family were hungry so we saw this place and went to it , we then came in and sat down. We then realized the menu is F*UCKING EXPENSIVE. ITS LIKE F*ICKING 15 DOLLAR FOR A FUCKING 2.5 OZ FUCKING BURGER . but anyways I digress. after we ordered it took GODDAMN 8 FUCKING HOURS just to get our food. but I digress. Overall I dont recommend this place the wait time is shit , food is overpriced , service is crap. Go to ihop instead

Restaurant quality food at a diner!  This place reminds me of New York/Jersey diners, but the food here is generally better.  Big View should please everyone with a wide variety of choices.  It's simple, reliable, and delicious.  I have tried many things on the menu and it is all good but I prefer the lunch items over breakfast.  I really like their soups and salads.  They market their desserts here with a big display at the entrance.  I have only tried couple of them but they were very good.  Last year I ordered Thanksgiving dinner here for my whole family.  Everything was delicious and we all loved it.  I am planning on doing the same this year.  Thanks Big View!

When did customer service die? I have no idea but it does not exist here. I had an interview in Ballentyne and I had some downtime between appointments. I went here to do a little work on my laptop and enjoy a light lunch. I waited until well after the lunch rush around 2 PM. Since I was there on my own, I sat in the bar area.   My order was not terribly complicated. I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and turkey chili combo. My food arrived after a moderate wait and looked appetizing. The grilled cheese sandwich was well prepared but the turkey chili was repulsive. Think about Hormel chili being dumped out of a can and then over seasoned to the point that it was inedible and you have an idea of how bad this was.   The problem was worsened by the fact  that my server did not check back on me once during the entire meal. My tea was never refilled and nobody came by to ask "How is your meal?" which is generally considered to be Restaurant 101. My server seemed to be more focused on chatting with friends and doing her side work so that she could punch out on time.   When someone arrived after the meal was clearly finished, she finally asked if everything was ok. I told her that the chili was inedible. It was clear that I had only taken one bite and then pushed it aside. She apologized and then brought the check which included a charge for the uneaten chili. I had an appointment scheduled and decided that $5 worth of chili was not worth dealing with drama. I paid the check and left. At least I know a restaurant to avoid the next time I am in Charlotte, NC.

Ah, where to start. How about with what I liked.   I loved their chandeliers and general decor. I liked their display cases and numerous desserts. My most of the  meal was pretty good and my husband liked his food as well    And what I didn't like.   The service was TERRIBLE. It took ages to put in our order. Our waitress forgot to put in my son's meal (we ordered for him as soon as we could because he was hungry and cranky). All of our food (except sons) arrived cold. I had a Cesar salad with my meal that was just awful. I told the server and she didn't offer to get me something else (like the soup). We ordered deviled eggs that weren't very good either. My husband ordered a milkshake to go and ended up throwing it away. How do you mess up a milkshake?

I  have never been disappointed when I've dined here. today was no exception. We had a family baby brunch event and out server, Allison was the best! The mimosas are on point and always great .FROM the homemade corned beef hash to the Thai chili wings, there's something for everyone's pallet! if you happen to have room left after your meal, then YOU MUST HAVE DESSERT, OMG!! You can bet your last buck it'll knock your socks off!!

This will be my first segmented review because parts of this restaurant just didn't jive with each other. To frame this review properly, I will note that we visited Big View on a Sunday at around 7:45am (well before the breakfast rush).  Service: 5 stars for Julie our supercharged waitress from Chicago. She was friendly & inviting from the very first moment. Despite being given tables in a haphazard manner, scattered throughout the diner, she was still on top of things while making sure we had a good time. Hands down she was one of the best parts of the entire experience.   Food: 2 stars. I wanted to give them more because the grub is damn tasty, but the kitchen screwed up on my order in such a basic way that it was obvious laziness. I had a breakfast quesadilla with chorizo & chipotle mole sauce in it. Guess which two ingredients were missing. Exactly. They fixed it, but it was a schoolboy error to begin with & not acceptable when we were eating long before the breakfast rush.   Atmosphere: 1 star. Other than our awesome waitress the rest of the place gave us the cold shoulder. I don't know if it was because we weren't regulars or because we were only 2 people at the big round corner booth, but the stink-eye was hurled in our direction when we weren't otherwise being blatantly ignored.   What really pissed me off was the manager guy (pink button-down shirt & glasses) who walked around greeting regulars & refilling coffee skipped us TWICE even though our cups were empty. How do you make new "regulars" if you treat first-timers so shabbily?  In spite of all this I would give them another chance.  The menu has a great variety and the food, when correctly made, was great.  Also, their baked items are rock solid.  I just know what to expect now and will be appropriately guarded next time I go.  Also, if Julie's not in then I'll hit somewhere else

Private parking lot Stopped by around 3pm, power went out at work, so go get cake! A couple of people at the bar and in the dining area.  Was greeted with a friendly hello and then I jetted to the restroom.  Restrooms where very clean and easy to locate by the bar.  I headed over to the bakery section.  Oh my decisions to be made, so many choices.  I had been craving a good and moist strawberry shortcake (hate dry cake) and they did not disappoint.  This cake was so moist and packed with fresh strawberries.  Huge slice for just $5 and I got the carrot cake as well.  Packed to go nicely and with care.  I will definitely go back for more cake and hopefully will have time to dine in one day soon.

The food is ok. The service unfortunately leaves A LOT to be desired. It's actually a hit or a miss. Sometimes you get attentive waiters/waitresses other times you get stuck with some that probably don't want to be there. I was there about 2 weeks ago and had EXCELLENT service, a waitress with a smile, made suggestions on entrees, brought out nice warm bread and was very attentive throughout our meal. Went back this past Saturday and was very dissappointed. Again, ordered 2 entrees - never any mention of bringing bread to our table. Ordered 2 coffees and the girl brought them out on 2 napkins (ALL the other tables had a plate under their coffee mugs). I tend to put a the empty cream, sugar and spoon on the plate. I asked her for 2 small plates for the coffee and she looked at me like I had 2 heads. Even asked "you want plates for the coffee cups? - like it was the strangest thing in the world". From then on - the service was super slow and then waited forever to get the check. Ordered disco fries and did not get to finish them so we asked to get them boxed up. When I get home I realize she packed up the top plain fries and did not add the cheese or the gravy that must have stayed in the bottom of the dish. These probably aren't huge things to complain about but they things that sort of turn you off from returning to a specific establishment - as is the case here.
